With world-class research possibilities and dedicated professors, students are given an education that prepares them for success. School spirit cannot be beaten, with the entire community rallying to support the Tigers in athletics. The campus is lovely, with a perfect combination of nature and top-notch facilities. Clemson offers a warm, nurturing environment in which students make lifelong friends. In the classroom, on the field, or in community service, Clemson is the best, and it is the ideal place to learn, develop, and thrive. Go Tigers!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Attending Colorado School Of Mines was probably the best decision I have ever made. The quality of education at this school is completely out of this world. Mines also does an excellent job preparing students for the workforce. Although the school is very academically driven, the social scene at Mines is also great (ex: Greek life, a variety of different clubs, etc...). With that being said, I believe that Mines could improve by improving the quality of life for freshman students (ex: renovating dorms, improving dining hall food, etc...).

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience with Oklahoma State University has been amazing so far! The campus feels like home, with so many friendly people and a strong sense of community. The professors genuinely care about your success, and I’ve learned so much in my classes. I’ve had the chance to connect with people who share similar passions, and I’ve been involved in events and clubs that have helped me grow both personally and professionally. The resources and opportunities available to students have really helped me shape my goals and push myself to be the best version of myself. Overall, OSU has provided me with a supportive and inspiring environment to learn, grow, and prepare for my future.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love the city of Pittsburgh and being a student at the University of Pittsburgh offers me endless opportunities to explore the local area. The professors in the School of Nursing are second to none and offer help whenever it is needed to ensure the success of all students. The housing options are just okay: very few dorms have good air conditioning and there are very few options for on-campus apartments that allow students to have ample privacy. The food options on campus are just okay as well as the on-campus dining halls have odd hours and have been known to cause sickness at times. They provide good options however and the on-campus restaurants are very easy to access. Overall, the University of Pittsburgh is an amazing school to attend and I am so grateful to have a chance to receive my education there.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: IU is a wonderful college with a beautiful campus! I've enjoyed all my classes so far! The professors are average I would say but some really do go above and beyond and truly care about their students. The campus is bigger than I initially thought so there will definitely be a lot of walking if you chose to attend, which isn't terrible unless it's winter. Downtown Bloomington is super cute as well. Party scene is fun but the bars can be strict so you really rely on Greek life before you're 21. I'm not in a sorority so I struggled with the party scene freshman and sophomore year. My only complaint is that Greek life is so big here that if you're not in it, sometimes it feels like you are missing out.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
For me it was the perfect school: I went to college wanting to work hard and study in depth in a few different areas (physics, mathematics, philosophy).  In addition I also got a huge benefit to life, research, and career by being part of a self-organized collective of advanced computer programmers.
Professors were (with very few exceptions) top-notch; expectations were high; other students were often very intelligent and motivated.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
I loved my time at BYU! As a Freshman I lived in on-campus housing. This afforded me many opportunities to be involved in campus activities such as dances, concerts, plays, pick-up frisbee games, $1 movies, etc. Being on campus provided easy access to all of these. 
The setting of campus is beautiful next to the mountains, as well as the campus itself. It is always well maintained and clean and well-lit. I was never concerned for my safety on campus.
My remaining years at BYU were also enjoyable. I felt the classes had high expectations and (most) of the professors taught and prepared me for meeting the rigor of the course. I loved that BYU offered NUMEROUS study abroad programs. For various reasons I was not able to participate in them, one being the SARS outbreak in China cancelling my student teaching there. I made life long friends and memories there.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Smith's reputation is no joke - the incredible internship offers and connections I've gotten from attending have blown my mind. Employers eat this school up.

Smith's academics are generally more rigorous than the other universities I've taken classes at. I chose it over my local T20. Women here are supported in classes in ways I think many students don't understand because they've never attended a co-ed school.

Sadly, many students here don't realize these privileges and it feels like a lot of wealthy students are competing in the oppression olympics, trying to pass for disadvantaged.

Smith is not a party school, but lots of students take the (free!) bus to UMass on Friday nights. Student life is good for me (an introvert from the midwest), but I can see someone from the city struggling socially.

While Smith offered me incredible aid my first year, they have removed ~$20k from my need-based package (family income didn't change). Don't take your first-year aid as a given.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved my time at the U! The environment is 100% what you make of it. If you want to party and take academics as secondary there are plenty of like minded people. But, it is also a great place if you do choose to focus on academics with challenging courses, knowledgeable professors, and lots of opportunity to conduct meaningful research. The campus is safe enough that I felt comfortable the vast majority of the time despite the very urban setting.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Michigan State was a mix of everything—great moments, tough challenges, and memories that stick. The campus was beautiful, especially in the fall, and game days were electric. The sense of community was strong, and it was easy to get caught up in the school spirit.

Academically, there were plenty of opportunities. Some classes felt huge, but once I got into my major, things got more personal. The resources were there if you looked for them. Professors were hit or miss, but the good ones made a real impact.

If I had to change anything, parking was a nightmare, and dealing with administration could be frustrating. Some classes could have been structured better.

Overall, MSU was what you made of it. The people, the traditions, and the late nights figuring things out—it all added up to something meaningful. Wouldn’t trade the experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Transferring to UMass Amherst as a Nutrition major was both exciting and overwhelming. Coming from a smaller environment, adjusting to such a large campus took time, especially while living off-campus right away. Navigating the dining halls, finding study spots, and balancing academics with commuting required effort, but I gradually found my rhythm. The Nutrition program is rigorous yet rewarding, with engaging professors and hands-on learning opportunities. The sense of community within the department helped me feel connected, despite being a transfer student. Though the campus can feel vast, I appreciate the resources, opportunities, and diversity that UMass offers.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
I loved being in DC while attending George Washington University. The location provided unparalleled access to internships, cultural institutions, and political events that enhanced my education beyond the classroom. The professors were very smart and demonstrated exceptional expertise in their fields. Many had worked in government or prominent organizations, bringing real-world insights to their teaching that made complex concepts more accessible.
However, the university lacked a strong sports scene compared to other schools. While there were Division I teams, they didn't generate the same campus-wide enthusiasm or unity you might find at larger state schools. This contributed to what I felt was not a strong sense of community at GW. The urban campus layout, with buildings spread throughout several city blocks rather than a traditional enclosed campus, sometimes made it difficult to feel connected to the broader student body.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Arizona State University (ASU) offers an incredible college experience with a vibrant campus life, outstanding academic opportunities, and a welcoming community. The university is known for its innovation, diverse student body, and commitment to student success.

One of the best things about ASU is the variety of resources available to students, from career services and networking events to research opportunities and top-tier faculty. The professors are passionate and knowledgeable, making classes engaging and valuable for future careers. Campus life is just as exciting, with plenty of clubs, organizations, and events that make it easy to get involved and meet new people. Whether it's Sun Devil football games, cultural festivals, or study sessions at the stunning Hayden Library, there's always something happening. The campus itself is beautiful, with great spots to relax, study, or hang out with friends!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
My experience at the University of Rochester has been truly wonderful. The campus is beautiful, and the sense of community is strong. I’ve appreciated the diversity of perspectives and the chance to engage with peers and professors who are passionate about their fields. The faculty are incredibly supportive, and there are so many opportunities for academic and personal growth.

If I could suggest one thing for improvement, it would be expanding resources for student wellness, including mental health support, to further enhance the well-being of the student body. Overall, I am grateful for my time here and feel fortunate to be part of such a dynamic and inclusive university.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love everything about TCU. It truly feel like a home away from home. They do an amazing job with making you feel connected to the school. Student life is great along with great dorms, athletics, and school spirit!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I enjoyed making friends and all the student orgs/extracurriculars I could join! Alongside that, there were many opportunities for connecting with faculty and others within my major. Only thing that I would like to see changed are possibly quicker responses to issues students bring up.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Bucknell is an excellent school, with unacceptable dining services. DO NOT come here if you are a vegetarian/vegan, care about healthy eating, or have an allergy. Last week, my friend with a nut allergy broke out in hives after eating a salad (and that's not an isolated incident). There are no vegan/vegetarian/healthy options since Bucknell changed dining providers, and while they made changes over winter break, they made no adjustments to accomodate students who fall into any of these categories. Instead, they added more fried chicken, burgers, and crepes to the menus. You can't even get a hot vegetable in the Bison or Commons dining areas (where upperclassman eat). I've communicated with them through their feedback texts, in a committee meeting, with the nutritionist, and over e-mail and provided multiple ideas on how they could improve things. Nothing has changed. All they've managed to do is stop serving raw chicken and the ramen noodles that turned people's urine neon green.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I absolutely love UAB! The campus is spacious and full of life, with beautiful facilities and a large, welcoming atmosphere. I adore the color green, so it was nice seeing it everywhere! my heart absolutely fluttered. The student life is INCREDIBLY diverse, with people from all walks of life coming together to create a rich, inclusive community. The clubs and organizations are incredibly welcoming, offering endless opportunities for personal growth and making lasting connections. UAB provides a dynamic environment where everyone feels like they belong and can truly survive. It’s a perfect place to learn, grow, and make memories!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Overall, Grinnell has been a good experience! The academics are certainly top-notch, and most professors are absolutely wonderful. Grinnell has a special student culture and dynamic that feels different from even other liberal arts colleges. Rural Iowa, albeit often a bit boring, is a surprisingly beautiful and certainly unique place to live for four years. I will say that the workload at Grinnell is really, really intense, and most people I know struggle mentally from the amount of pressure their courses put on them. It can be really hard to find a good work/life balance and this makes it a lot harder to make friends as well. The dining hall (D-hall, as we affectionately call it) is not as bad as students say, but it is certainly not Michelin-level cuisine either. Grinnell's administration is also really poorly run and can be frustrating at times. Overall, I'm happy with my choice, even if I regret it when I'm drowning in homework during my finals week.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: As a current student at the University of South Carolina, my experience has been a mix of excitement and growth. The campus is stunning, especially the historic Horseshoe, and the blend of historic and modern facilities creates an inspiring atmosphere. Professors are approachable, and the university offers excellent resources like tutoring and career services. Gamecock pride is contagious, and football games are an unforgettable highlight of student life. There’s also a wide range of clubs and activities, making it easy to find a community. That said, parking is a challenge it’s expensive and limited. Safety in areas around campus could be improved with better lighting and patrols. Dining options can get repetitive, and some dorms need renovations. Large class sizes in popular majors also make it harder to get individualized attention. Despite these challenges, UofSC offers an incredible experience overall. Go Gamecocks!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience at the University of Mississippi has been amazing. From the welcoming campus to the passionate professors, I’ve felt supported every step of the way. The campus is beautiful, with stunning architecture and plenty of green spaces. Professors are deeply invested in student success, and the resources available make it easy to excel academically. Student life is vibrant, with countless clubs and activities that make it easy to connect with others. The school spirit here is unmatched, and I love being part of the Rebel family. I wouldn’t change a thing about my time at Ole Miss, it's been a place where I’ve grown academically, socially, and personally, and I’m incredibly proud to be a part of it. Hotty Toddy!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Hi! I’m freshman at Rutgers University- New Brunswick, I am also apart of Honors College. Enrolling at Rutgers was one of my best decisions in life. People here are amazing, so are professors and classes, some of which are challenging, but very well organized, fun and have an enormous impact on the students. Party life is also very vibrant and important among students. If you like balance between good academics and party scene- choose Rutgers.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Our visiting professors for the Business and Economics department are impeccable. It is also quite fun to learn with the Block Plan system at our school. I'd like to continue seeing top-notch visiting professors, and to see more scholarship opportunities for business ventures.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My overall experience with the University of Oklahoma has been very fulfilling. My freshman year, I joined a sorority and a dance club where I was able to meet so many new people and connect with others on different levels. Through my sorority, I was also able to participate in University Sing and Scandals performances which was very entertaining for me since I grew up dancing. I later joined the University Sing Executive Team where I had the opportunity to give critiques to participating casts and perform in the show. I love the many opportunities the University offers for students to become involved!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Being a student at Texas Tech was the best decision I have ever made. My experience at Texas Tech University has been amazing! I love the vibrant campus atmosphere and the strong sense of community. One of my favorite aspects of Texas Tech is the variety of extracurricular activities and organizations available. There’s something for everyone, whether you’re into academic clubs, cultural groups, or recreational sports. These opportunities have allowed me to make lifelong friends and develop skills outside of the classroom. The sports events, especially football games, are always thrilling and bring everyone together. The campus itself is beautiful with lots of green spaces and spots to relax or study. The community and students here are so fun and amazing it makes you feel at home. If I were to suggest something to change, maybe more diverse food options on campus could be a hit. Also, the housing they are a bit small, and I think they could use an upgrade.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: Although I’ve been accepted to Penn State and will begin in the fall of 2025, my connection to the university runs deep. As a native of State College, Penn State has always felt like home. Growing up here, I attended countless events—from thrilling football games to captivating theater productions—experiencing firsthand the strong sense of community that unites students, faculty, and alumni. Beyond its world-class academics, I chose Penn State for its deep sense of connection, where camaraderie only grows after graduation. This bond is something I truly admire. I’m also passionate about changing misconceptions surrounding Penn State students. We are not only fun-loving but driven, intelligent, and academically accomplished. I’m excited for the limitless opportunities for growth at Penn State and eager to embrace everything this journey has to offer. I feel incredibly fortunate to pursue my education here. One thing is certain: We ARE!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
My overall experience at the University of Utah has been pretty solid! One of the things I really appreciated is the beautiful campus, it’s surrounded by mountains, so the views are stunning, especially in the fall and winter. The school has strong academics, particularly in health sciences, which is what I’m interested in, and there’s a lot of support for research and hands-on learning. Professors are generally approachable, and I’ve found many of them genuinely want to help you succeed.

The student body is pretty diverse, and the school offers lots of opportunities to connect with others through clubs, cultural organizations, and events. As someone from a Latin American background, I’ve appreciated finding spaces to celebrate my culture and meet others with similar experiences.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved going to Bryn Mawr! The chemistry department is amazing. You get to work one on one with professors and they make it easy to join a lab and start doing real research early on.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Wabash College was a wonderful place for an undergraduate education due to its small class sizes, extensive alumni connections, and incredible professor accessibility. I enjoyed Wabash since every student can participate in class, extracurricular clubs and organizations, and academic presentations or events of interest. I enjoyed Wabash due to my ability to take control of my education and reach out for help when needed. I would like to see more specific internship opportunities for individuals looking to pursue various healthcare-related fields, but also humanities-related careers.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: New Mexico Tech is incredible in the way that it prepares students. There are small class sizes, strong department communities, and extremely professional instructors. There are also many opportunities for research available. The coursework is extremely difficult compared to other universities, so much so, that when employers compare NMT candidates against ones from other schools, they often add a full GPA point to the NMT candidate's application. The campus is small and gorgeous with excellent landscaping and a beautiful field and golf course. As far as social life, it's difficult to make time outside of studies. When you do have free time, there's very few activities available in the town to spend it on. The school hosts many events throughout the year, but these are infrequent and attendance is often low. Rugby is the main sport and there are lots of scholarships for it.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
I'm a current freshman at CSULB. My experience so far has been amazing. I love how helpful the staff and counselors are on campus. They provide so many resources to the students. 
The academic level is really good too, I benefitted a lot from my last semester classes. My only complain is that some teachers syllabus or curriculums are just a bit challenging to keep up with. With the school being packed the classes are filled up quickly. But overall its an awesome school. Ive made many connections with people that where so beneficial, whether its teachers, friends, or TA's that would help you find your way through college, and with the schools diverse population this definitely helped!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
My overall experience at the College of the Holy Cross has been a mix of positives and negatives. The party culture is strong, especially from Thursday to Sunday, and smoking is quite common. While some students are highly focused on academics, the majority seem more relaxed, and only about 50 freshmen maintain a GPA above 3.5.

On the bright side, the professors here are very nice and supportive, which makes a big difference in the learning experience. However, the food and housing leave much to be desired. The quality of meals on campus isn’t great, and the living conditions could definitely be improved.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
Coming to Pitzer College was one of the best decisions I've made in my life. The campus is truly unique, the professors are great, and the people are even better. 

If you are considering applying to Pitzer, please take note of the following...
- Academics are HARD. You will have a lot of work...But it is manageable.
- TONS of clubs and student ran organizations
- Supportive professors that care about their students (always open to meet or just talk if needed) 
- 5C advantage (BEST PART, let me explain) 
Pitzer is a member of the 5Cs, meaning you can take classes at any of the colleges (You can also off campus major if Pitzer doesn't offer a specific study/disciplinary you are interested in), Additionally, lots of students from all schools interact, are in clubs together, and actually support each other. 
- Food is world-class, and dining options are never slim (7 dining halls on campus). 

Hope this helps, GO HENS!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The University of Kansas is a wonderful university for students to attend. There are more than thirty-thousand students on campus, so there is an endless opportunity to create relationships and bonds with others. KU is known for their phenomenal sports programs, and attending the sporting events each week allows opportunity for new friendships and a love for sports to be created. There is nothing short of things to do in Lawrence and Kansas City is only twenty minutes away from campus. I greatly enjoyed the nice weather and beautiful campus KU offered this fall! One thing I would like to see change would be an improvement in dining hall food. The options are the same each day and do not taste the best. For example, changing the food rotation would help considerably. Overall, I am a proud Jayhawk and am very content with my choice of university.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Santa Clara has a lovely environment full of students passionate about making the world a better place. I walk around campus everyday and know that we are all dedicated to our work and bettering ourselves. Then the weekend comes and we know how to unwind and have fun. The balance of work hard-play hard is something that emanates through our campus. Overall, Santa Clara University is a place that embodies the Jesuit value of Cura Personalis, caring for the whole person in mind, body, and spirit.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My experience with the University of Alabama’s online program has been nothing short of amazing. The flexibility has been a game-changer, allowing me to balance my full-time job in event management while working toward my degree. The professors are knowledgeable, the courses are well-structured, and the support from advisors and staff has been incredible. Even though it’s online, I still feel connected to the university and part of the Alabama family. The program has given me the skills and confidence to advance in my career, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a high-quality, flexible education. Roll Tide!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Michigan Tech is a great school, especially if you're into engineering or tech-related fields. The campus has a really cool vibe—it's surrounded by nature, so you’re never far from a hike or some outdoor fun. The professors are pretty passionate about what they teach, and there’s a strong sense of community with students helping each other out. One thing I’d change, though, is the weather—it’s brutal in the winter! Also, it would be awesome if there were more social events or places to hang out, especially for students looking for a break from all the studying.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Iowa State University offers a strong academic experience, particularly in fields like engineering, agriculture, and veterinary medicine, with a supportive faculty and ample research opportunities. The campus is vibrant, with a variety of student organizations and a passionate sports culture that fosters school spirit. However, some areas could be improved, such as campus housing, parking, and the rising cost of living in Ames. Additionally, some students feel certain programs could benefit from more diversity, and graduate students could use more tailored career development resources. Overall, ISU provides a positive and engaging environment, though there are a few aspects that could enhance the student experience further.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
As an international student from Greece, it is absolutely incredible. The professors are very talkative, engaged and genuinely want their students to succeed and be the best versions of themselves. The peers are helpful in homework and notes exchanging, The campus is absolutely beautiful and there are activities one can attend every single day; one can simply never be bored, and the opportunities to get involved in research even as undergraduate students are great! 

However, as a severely disabled individual (hard of hearing) the resources have not been that great. The office of accessibility and services are not helping students that much, so many students who are disabled have to fend off for themselves. In addition, there are not that many international students and the diversity is not great, having the institution be represented by a predominantly white campus.

Yet, other factors such as rigorours academics and a decent party scene and campus life cancel this out! Great overall

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Attending UD was one of the high points of my life. I learned so much academically, personally, professionally and spiritually. To try describe the campus life, culture and community would be futile.  It is something you see and feel immediately when stepping on campus. I would not trade my experience at University of Dayton for anything.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: One thing I really enjoy about Trinity is its academics and faculty. Every professor I have had has been extremely accommodating, kind, and passionate about their work and teaching.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved my time with Eastern New Mexico University. The tuition was low, and the classes were not overly time consuming. They also offered the Zondervan program for Religious Studies, which I pursued as my minor. It has a very small college feel, while offering some of the options you would expect from a larger university. I would like in the future to see more options for remote work available from the school, especially to alumni who would like to teach online classes. I also would like to see more organization in communication with students. Sometimes the students have to search out answers, that I feel should be more readily available to them, such as due dates. I also would like to see an expanded variety of online classes offered, as sometimes certain classes you need to graduate are only offered in specific semesters. This delays students who are on track, and can be very frustrating. Overall I would recommend ENMU to anyone however, and I hope to see the University grow soon!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I am currently a Sophomore at the University of San Diego. I have had many (both positive and negative) experiences over the past two years. However, this semester I am trying to turn all of my negative experiences into more positive ones by focusing more on my academics, and also trying to become a more healthy person overall. The school itself is absolutely gorgeous and I appreciate how small the classes are. The only thing I would change is the dorms. I feel like it is important to have some type of AC unit for when the weather becomes hotter.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: Attending the University of Arkansas in Fayetteville for my undergraduate nursing degree was a transformative experience. The rigorous coursework, hands-on clinical training, and supportive faculty helped shape me into the healthcare professional I am today. My time at the UofA laid a strong foundation for my nursing career and future aspirations as a family nurse practitioner and nurse educator. One change I'd like to see would be to increase support and resources for nursing students, especially in terms of clinical placement opportunities and hands-on experience. While the program is well-structured, securing diverse and high-quality clinical rotations can sometimes be challenging. Expanding partnerships with more healthcare facilities, offering more simulation labs, or increasing faculty mentorship opportunities could further enhance the learning experience for future nursing students.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I've had a great time at Binghamton University! Campus is safe, food is okay, and dorms are different depending on which community you live in. Highly recommend!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: University of North Carolina School of the Arts

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I have had such a great time here, but there are definitely some things the school needs to work on. Campus community is a big one, we don't have much interconnection between disciplines. I also think that connection to the city of Winston-Salem could be worked on.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
My experience at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo has been both challenging and rewarding. As a Business Administration major concentrating in Real Estate Finance, I’ve had the opportunity to take rigorous courses like Real Estate Investment, Real Estate Finance, and Fixed Income Securities Market, which have helped me build a strong analytical foundation for my career in commercial real estate. Cal Poly’s Learn by Doing philosophy is definitely present in my coursework. Many of my classes are hands-on, requiring case studies, Excel modeling, financial analysis, and real-world applications.  My professors have been knowledgeable and supportive.
San Luis Obispo is a beautiful and vibrant town, and I love the outdoor lifestyle—hiking, surfing, and exploring the Central Coast. I’m also involved in Greek Life which has provided leadership and networking opportunities. The Real Estate Club has been another great way to meet like-minded students and industry professionals.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My four years at Brandeis were the best years of my life. I met the most amazing people, made the best friends, and even found a partner for life. The professors were extremely caring and always went out of their way to support their students. As students, we were encouraged to explore new ideas and study all sorts of interesting topics within and outside our primary field of study. I had plenty of fun at student club events, and being just a 20 minute train ride from Boston was awesome. I love this place and I will cherish my Brandeis memories forever.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I transferred to UCONN and love it! There is partys, bars, frats and a big party life. School spirit is unmatched. I love the downtown area, everything you need is right on campus. Adding onto the downtown, there are lots of job opportunities right here and also some "on campus" jobs at the dining halls and the union.  Love how many dining halls there are, no matter where you are on campus you are near a dining hall. I've never had a problem with housing, but it is a mess and it's hard to get housing. DON'T LIVE IN NORTH( i had to move I had huge roaches). The did give me a hard time switching to another room but after persistent emails they finally found me a new room. Buses can be tricky, some are late or never show up.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: WSU is a great school and has very many nationally recognized colleges. The location is a college town (Pullman) in the middle of nowhere on the East side of WA. If you like small town vibes and don’t mind driving an hour to get to the nearest city (Spokane), then you will be okay. The party scene is mostly Greek life and there are a handful of bars. The student life can be really great if you join clubs/organizations there are many to offer! Getting involved with student body government and the many branches is highly recommended, including affinity groups. They have many resources centers and services!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: CUNY John Jay College of Criminal Justice

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at John Jay has been amazing so far! Everyone made me feel welcome and helped me with everything. The professors are really approachable and their lessons are interesting and engaging. The campus life is awesome, there are many student from different parts of the world, yet everyone is connected in John Jay community.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
My experience at Stevens Institute of Technology has been largely positive. The professors are passionate about their subjects and genuinely care about student success. The campus is beautiful, with great resources like labs and study spaces that support both academic and personal growth. I especially appreciate the strong emphasis on real-world application of knowledge, particularly through internships and research opportunities.

However, there are areas for improvement. The social scene could be more inclusive and varied, with more events or spaces that cater to different interests.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: I am the parent of a Mount Holyoke senior.  This review is a warning to parents about the financial aid process and rising costs each year.  We recieved a great aid package the first year with our contribution coming it at just over $21k.  We assumed this would remain in the same ballpark each year and committed to the school.  Year two our contribution increased to $25k which seemed reasonable, then year three it went up to over $34k.  Our financial aid officer told me there had been a mistake with our income the first two years, we had recieved "a deal" and nothing could be done.  We made some sacrifices and made the payments, believing the last year would not cost significatily more because the "mistake" had been reconciled.  Well, the aid letter we recieved for year four showed our contribution was over $60k!  I protested the increased and the bill was reduced to just under $50k.  Our income did increase some each year but not at a rate commensurate with our bill.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
I have really enjoyed being a student here! The atmosphere is really positive and I have been benefitting from all my classes. Dorm life is pretty good and the resources here are super helpful (campus pantry, meal swipes, academic support, mental/medical support, etc.) I really love the cultural aspects of the school and all the opportunities to learn about those cultures, their languages, and even to travel to other countries to have school there for a semester or two.
I will say, though, I am not a fan of the pricing. I guess nothing comes for free, but I think I could use a break from my lack of sufficient funding. Even with some discounts due to my father working here and getting me free tuition, it is incredibly expensive.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Mississippi State University has truly become my home. The sense of community and intentionality that surrounds MSU is unmatched. The people are genuinely invested in each other’s growth, fostering an environment where I can thrive academically, personally, and socially.

The opportunities for involvement have been a huge highlight. Whether it’s serving on my sorority’s executive board, being part of PL College, or engaging with organizations like UWIB  and Puppies with a Purpose, MSU has provided countless avenues for leadership development and connection.

I’m also grateful for the support and resources available, especially from faculty and alumni connections, which have played a significant role in my personal growth.

As for improvements, I’d love to see more hands-on experiences in marketing and business and additional spaces for relaxation and studying outside traditional classrooms. Overall, I’m incredibly grateful for my time at MSU and excited to continue my journey here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My experience at Oxy was awesome!  Loved my academic experience, being an athlete, and the overall care and connection in the Oxy community.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love it here! Sometimes the food isn't very good, but I personally live off-campus, so I usually just eat at my own house. I also have no experience with the housing, but I have heard from other people that it isn't very good after your first-year of school. Most of my professors have been really good, but there are some that haven't been good, but the overall course, and academics are extremely good, and I love the things we are learning on the pre-med track!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at the University of South Florida has been great and all that I have hoped for. I have loved my professors, my class schedule, and how welcoming everyone is. The one change, however, that I would like to see is more campus life. More events and more to do outside of class.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Oregon State University is a great place with a welcoming community. The people here are really nice, and there are many good spots to eat and study with classmates. I’ve enjoyed the supportive atmosphere and the variety of study spaces available. One thing that could improve is having even more late-night food options for students who study late. Overall, it’s been a positive experience!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
My experience has been incredibly rewarding. As an international student, I’ve had the chance to immerse myself in a new culture while building meaningful connections. I love how my university offers diverse opportunities, from academic resources to organizations like the Missouri International Students Council, where I served as Vice President. These roles allowed me to develop leadership skills, work with budgets, and foster a sense of community.

However, I’d like to see greater support for international students, particularly in financial aid and job opportunities. The high cost of living on campus often creates challenges, and part-time jobs don’t always cover expenses. More mentorship programs and networking events to connect international and domestic students could also help bridge cultural gaps further. Overall, my experience has been transformative, but these changes could make it even more inclusive and supportive.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Loyola Marymount University promotes inclusivity and strives for its students to be global change makers. Although Loyola Marymount University is in an ideal location, and the views are only to be described as breathtaking, that is only one of the multifaceted qualities of this school. From my personal experience, I have made important connections with professors and other fellow students that will last a lifetime. It is refreshing to finally engage in an environment where students and professors encourage those to succeed. Furthermore, my homework load is challenging, but it is not unbearable. I have always been involved in extra curricular activities, in addition to school, so college has only furthered my driven mindset. Lastly, I enjoy the unlimited opportunities provided by the group organizations on campus. I have received a countless amount of network possibilities in both Marketing and Dance fields, solely due to my affiliation in both programs.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
As an alum of Drexel University, I can confidently say it was the perfect choice for me. Growing up in the suburbs, I wanted a truly immersive city experience, and Drexel's prime location in Philadelphia provided just that. The vibrant urban environment offered endless opportunities for exploration, learning, and cultural enrichment.

What truly set Drexel apart for me was its renowned co-op program. It gave me invaluable real-world work experience that not only enhanced my education but also prepared me for life after graduation.

That said, Drexel is undeniably expensive, and even 12 years later, I’m still paying off my student loans. Despite the cost, I highly recommend it. The unique combination of a city lifestyle and hands-on professional opportunities made my experience at Drexel both life-changing and worth every penny.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
I would like more trees and greenery on campus! There's only one area with a good amount of grass, and its always filled with students who want a touch of nature. If there were more places like this (the turtle pond/hill), I think students would be more satisfied and appreciative of mother nature. 

Give us dining hall's! The only options we have for food are fast food/sit down restaurants. Although everything tastes good, students need to learn how to cook their own meals and eat more organic food. I think that I've gotten much more unhealthy since I started here- mainly due to my food options.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Union University is a small Christian college known for having the best business department in the area. As a transfer student, I’ve fallen in love with the many opportunities the university offers and am excited to see what I can accomplish during my time here.

Although I enjoy being at Union, commuting to and from campus daily has been challenging—especially since my car is constantly breaking down. With the money, I could put it toward buying a new car, which I am currently saving for.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love the university overall, though I think there could be some minor improvements. Kansas State University (KSU) offers a well-rounded experience marked by academic rigor, a strong sense of community, and diverse extracurricular opportunities. Students at KSU benefit from a supportive environment where faculty are approachable and passionate about their fields. The university’s programs in agriculture, engineering, and business are particularly well-regarded, but KSU also excels in arts, sciences, and veterinary medicine. Campus life is lively, with student organizations, Greek life, and numerous events throughout the year. Manhattan, Kansas, the home of KSU, provides a small-town feel while still offering various cultural and recreational activities. The university’s commitment to student success is reflected in its resources, including tutoring, career services, and mental health support.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at CSM has been good so far, aside from a few issues here and there. Its location is excellent, being at the heart of Omaha and having Aksarben village nearby gives the students something to do. The dorms are alright, I wouldn't give them the best rating, mainly Lozier. The higher rating would go to the new dorms, Steven's Halls. The school might not be a party school but the people find meaningful ways to pass their time.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
My experience at the University of Idaho has been rewarding and enriching. The professors are knowledgeable and supportive, creating a strong academic environment with personalized attention. The campus is beautiful, and the sense of community makes it a welcoming place to learn and grow.

There are plenty of opportunities to get involved, from student organizations to career services that help with internships and job placement. Campus life is vibrant, with events, athletics, and outdoor activities that enhance the student experience. The surrounding area offers great recreational options, adding to the university’s appeal.

Overall, my time at the University of Idaho has been positive, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a supportive and engaging college experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I highly recommend Yeshiva University for an excellent college experience- I love the classes, have great roommates and love being in the center of Manhattan. There is a diverse student body with interesting people  from around the world! The professors are easy to talk to and take an interest in your success. I hope you’ll consider coming here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
I loved my time at Wheaton and truly appreciated the community overall. Professors were always open to office hours while academics were rigorous and challenging (the fact that every student worked hard was a motivating factor as well). I felt that I developed strong friendships that will last a lifetime. Having Bible studies and weekly worship were also crucial in my walk of faith and developing a sense of community on campus.
One (rather small) critique that I have is housing. I believe it is essential that students have the option to live off-campus and/or have more options to live in their own rooms.
One other thing to note is that Wheaton is a great school for those who know their calling. The academics, connections, and community will encourage and help build the skills you need to get to the next step. For those who are a little lost in terms of career plans, this can be a harder environment to be in (though I still encourage you to apply/visit).

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: University of Houston was a great school to attend for my undergraduate. I thoroughly enjoyed my time spent there. I thought that campus life was great, especially being in the heart of Houston, although I felt that campus security could be increased. Athletics was a huge part of my campus life, and it was a great atmosphere to be apart of and witness. The students and community were a great support to athletics and made it that much more enjoyable. I would definitely recommend University of Houston to others that love being in a big city and being able to have some many opportunities within reach!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
Choosing Rose-Hulman as my college has been one of the best decisions I’ve made. Rose offers unique, one-of-a-kind majors, a supportive student affairs team, and a dedicated alumni network that enriches both your time on campus and your opportunities after graduation.

I’ve been fortunate to build strong connections with professors, administrative staff, alumni, and other professionals, all made possible by the close-knit community and small class sizes. While the academic workload can be intense—that’s engineering!—the experience has been incredibly rewarding. Beyond academics, Rose-Hulman provides countless opportunities to grow, with a welcoming student body and a vibrant residence life. Freshman year, in particular, is a highlight, with supportive upperclassmen helping you feel right at home.

Choosing Rose-Hulman was easy, and I haven’t regretted it for a moment!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Denison University is a private liberal arts college located in Granville, Ohio. Known for its rigorous academic programs and vibrant campus life, Denison offers a wide range of majors and minors that cater to diverse interests! Denison is committed to providing students with opportunities for personal and professional growth. The career services department is highly regarded, offering resources and support for internships, job placements, and graduate school applications. The university offers a plethora of programs for social events, keeping the student body engaged and involved! Overall, Denison University is an excellent choice for students seeking a comprehensive liberal arts education in a supportive and engaging environment.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Attending Lafayette College has been a highly rewarding experience, both academically and personally. The college's commitment to a rigorous, yet supportive academic environment has allowed me to thrive in my chosen field of study. The small class sizes foster meaningful interactions with professors, who are not only experts in their fields but also genuinely invested in students' success. This personalized approach to education has been one of the most impactful aspects of my time at Lafayette.

One of the things I value most is the sense of community at Lafayette. With a student body that is relatively small, I have had the opportunity to collaborate closely with peers, engage in research, and contribute to campus life through various student organizations. This tight-knit environment has provided me with both a solid academic foundation and a deep sense of belonging, helping me grow as a person and a professional.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My overall experience with the University of Illinois Chicago has been both enriching and diverse, shaped by the university's commitment to academic excellence, cultural diversity, and community engagement. Located in one of the most vibrant cities in the United States, UIC provides a unique blend of opportunities for both personal and professional growth. One of the standout features of UIC is its diverse student body. As a large urban university, UIC attracts students from all over the world, creating a melting pot of cultures, backgrounds, and perspectives. This diversity has been a highlight of my time at UIC, as it has allowed me to interact with peers who bring unique viewpoints to the table. The university’s commitment to inclusivity is evident in its various cultural centers, which provide spaces for students to explore and celebrate their heritage while also fostering a sense of belonging. UIC offers a range of support services designed to help students succeed academically.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: PARENT REVIEW (sorry if this isn't allowed).  This review might be premature, but she is loving life.  We are thrilled with how well she is doing, and how excited she is to be there.  It's comforting knowing your daughter is attending a school with a safe campus, and a caring faculty.  We visited an excessive amount of schools, and Furman was the one campus that the entire family liked.  The campus is beautiful, the student body looks normal, the faculty had the right answers to our questions, and the campus is secure.  During our TOURS we engaged as many students as possible, and this is the only campus that 100% of the students could have a mature intelligent conversation.  Her classes have been difficult but fair.  The professors have been encouraging and available when she has questions.  Importantly, there is no political unrest on campus which I attribute to the normal looking students that can have an adult conversation.  The food is good too.  Take a tour and see for yourself!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I love my experience at Skidmore. My first year, I was able to take a variety of classes in different departments to figure out where I felt most at home, and many of our classes are interdisciplinary. It is easy and encouraged to have multiple majors/minors, and most professors are amazing! They truly are a great resource that I was not expecting to have, especially coming from a bigger high school. I have been fortunate to hold several campus jobs, including being a tour guide, tutor, and RA. There are also tons of opportunities for students to get involved in administrative, career-preparing work through our SGA and various campus committees--most searches and voting committees will have at least one student representative, and overall the opportunities are vast.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: College of the Ozarks is quite different than most University's. For starters they offer there excellent work program that offers students the opportunity to have their full tuition paid in full while still having to pay for room and board. But besides the point life on campus is quite nice. It takes time to grow into what you want to be here, but is that not the same for any college? This school teaches you great time management skills of both work time, school time, and trying to fit in personal time when you can. There bachelors programs are all excellent offering niche majors alongside some of the best programs in the state of Missouri such as Nursing. Most people in the Midwest area if they see a College of Ozarks student apply for a job, they will hire them. But other than that it has taken me some time but this place has grown on me exponentially.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: The professors at PLNU care about their students and are passionate about teaching. The quality of academics is fairly good compared to other small liberal arts schools. Student body pool size is very small compared to a state school which gives it sort of a high school social feel versus a traditional college campus. Looking back I would have preferred going to a bigger school with more students and school spirit. There's really no school spirit around sporting events other than homecoming. Chapel is a requirement to attend a couple of days a week for undergraduate students. If you don't attend you must pay a fee for every chapel missed. Faith is a very important element at the school which I wasn't fully aware of before attending. About half of the students hold their Christian values tightly and there seems to be sort of a clique separating religious/not very religious students.  The campus is on the beach with a beatiful view from classrooms and dorms which is a redeeming quality.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Though I have only been on campus for half of a year, Delaware is a beautiful university that has already brought me some of my life-long friendships, and it has truly brought me out of my comfort zone! There is a whole different level of independence that I gained from committing to Delaware, but knowing I am currently applying a great educational institution pushes me to do the best I can with my grades, social life, athletics, and much more. The professors are some of the nicest people I have met, and they are so willing to help their students with any questions or problems that they may face. I was able to build a deep and meaningful relationship with them that further involved me and excited me for class. I am so blessed to say I am able to attend the University of Delaware, and it has brought such wonderful meaning to my higher education.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: So far, this university has been pretty chill. Depending on the community you hang out with, they're cool to hang out with and helps you make a lot of friends in college. You would definitely need that to make connections after graduation. There's also restaurants on campus, much like any other colleges, but I wish there's more like LSU. I also wish they either add more parking spaces or revamp the parking system. Even though I do not have a car, I have often experienced my friend's struggle of trying to find parking when going home or going to class.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved St. Olaf! As a recent graduate, now that I am finished with my time as an Ole I always look back on it fondly. It is a perfect size - and with Carleton close by, there are more social opportunities than a small school would typically provide. As someone with a Carl as a partner, Olaf was definitely the better experience of the two. I am always surprised how many people around the world know St. Olaf. Olaf is a great choice if you're interested in study abroad, building a strong community and has alums that are passionate about the school. Rural Minnesota can be boring, but this leading to students staying on campus and spending time with one another. It can be difficult to get to the cities. The administration is also very compassionate and really wants to help. I also recommend visiting the many cultural events on campus - I loved all of the student theater events throughout the semester! Olaf is also a great choice for avoiding Greek life.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: A nice school for geeks and nerds alike, uplifting each other in exploring the field of engineering.  I found campuses and students great, even if I commuted most of the year.  The academic courses, third and fourth year for Computer Science, were in-depth, specialized, and informative; while the first two were, while not exactly exciting, covered the necessary basics to help students explore the more specialized courses.  I do think some older dorms could use some work; newer, albeit more expensive dorms and cafeterias were pretty good, though.  Overall, had a good time, and the education served well in my professional work as well.  A self-motivated student can make the most out of RPI.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: It is a service academy so it is much different from other colleges, however that is one of the reeasons I enjoy it

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I have absolutely loved my time here at WPI so far. I have gotten involved in a varsity sport, Greek life, and other clubs and organizations which have made the campus feel like home. I came to WPI because I knew I wanted to do fire protection engineering but was worried about being so far from home. Though getting adjusted to campus was a little rocky, as soon as I started getting involved all my fears faded. Walking around campus I always see familiar faces and have never once felt unsafe even when walking to friends' apartments off campus. If you enjoy being well-rounded and are interested in any of the majors WPI offers I highly recommend coming here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My Harding experience was amazing, and I'd recommend it for anyone looking for a good Christian education. The university is beautiful, facilities amazing and education is top-notch. I was well-prepared to enter my field (business management). The educators truly care about their students.  Harding truly seeks excellence.  They have some rules in place that some feel are too restrictive, but its a trade-off for keeping a culture that is God honoring as well as safe. The school is not urban, though it's not far from Little Rock.  I liked that the fact that most students travel great distances to attend Harding stay there through the weekends. It makes campus life a lot of fun at all times. Harding also has several campuses worldwide (Africa, Italy, Australia, Greece, etc) where students can attend. Harding is not for everybody, but it's truly a place, in my opinion, which provided me with an amazing experience I could get nowhere else.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience at Florida A&M University has been amazing so far. I have stepped outside of my comfort zone and made many new friends. My professors are amazing too! They are always there to answer my questions in class and outside of class. The staff at FAMU has been very helpful also, especially the Financial Aid staff. Not only do they answer all of my questions, they go above and beyond to make sure I understand what they said. My campus is safe and very lively! There are events almost every weekend to ensure students are having fun while also getting their education.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: As an introvert, the party scene at Syracuse University was a bit daunting, but after my four years here I can confidently say you do not need to be a partier to have fun here. The weather makes campus a bit dismal but the fall, summer, and spring make up for it! I loved the area enough to stay for an extra year post grad and made some life long friends both local to Syracuse and through the college.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: My favorite aspect of Hampden-Sydney college is the close, tight-knit community that shares the value of building brotherhood throughout the college and maintaining a higher standard for the students through the Honor Code.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Located in Midtown Detroit, Michigan is Wayne State University. I love it's location! Easy access to whatever you need and there is always something to do when the studies allow, either on campus or nearby. It's a large campus, nearly 24,000 scholars, with a very homey or family feel. I am pursuing a bachelor's degree in Information Technology.  I love living on campus in one of the residence halls where I hope next year to be a residence hall advisor. My professors,  academic and financial advisors are easily assessible. If there was anything that I could change at this would be to re-open the Starbucks that is attached to my residence hall!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: So far, National University has surpassed my expectations. The quickness and quality of communication have truly impressed me. From prompt responses to  guidance and support system, National University has made my academic journey seamless and enjoyable. One of the aspects I appreciate the most is the extensive selection of online degree programs and courses. I am currently enrolled in the Bachelor of Arts in Integrative Psychology program and am incredibly grateful for the holistic-focused classes available. These courses align perfectly with my passion for understanding and promoting overall well-being. Additionally, National University’s four-week course schedules have proven to be a great structure for learning. Overall, my experience with National University has been outstanding, and I look forward to continuing my journey with such a supportive and well-structured institution.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
It was great! Everyone was so welcoming and nice! I was a new kid, and I was instantly accepted.
It was great! Everyone was so welcoming and nice! I was a new kid, and I was instantly accepted.It was great! Everyone was so welcoming and nice! I was a new kid, and I was instantly accepted.It was great! Everyone was so welcoming and nice! I was a new kid, and I was instantly accepted.It was great! Everyone was so welcoming and nice! I was a new kid, and I was instantly accepted.It was great! Everyone was so welcoming and nice! I was a new kid, and I was instantly accepted.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: I just loved it here!! The area isn't the coolest, but it's practically twenty minutes from everything and the campus is beautiful. The students here are so welcoming and warm. Staff is attentive, and professors have no issue circling back for you. I am about to start their psych program, and here it's one of the best in California, and I am very excited about that. I would say dorm life can vary, but all on good terms. Getting to know people is really easy; it just takes that extra little push to get started. Something I recommend is diving into student life and clubs!!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I absolutely love the school and the community. Everyone is super friendly. The food is amazing that even student From Brown comes to eat. On top of that, I got to gain resources From Brown as well, which is such an advantage. I just absolutely love the quiet Vibe and aesthetic of Providence. The school is rigorous and informative. The library is absolutely stunning!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: South Dakota School of Mines and Technology

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: The campus puts academics first and foremost. Classes range from medium to hard difficulty, but many professors are passionate about their topics and willing to help. The biggest drawbacks include the dining hall food and some dorms being lower quality. However, the opportunities that come from Mines will get you very well-positioned for life after college. You will just have to work hard for the four years until then.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Walking through Tulsa University’s campus, I feel immense pride as the first in my family to attend college. The isolation can be real. Many of my classmates come from families where college is expected, even assumed. They have guidance from parents and family who all have done this before. Meanwhile, I’m figuring everything out on my own financial aid, class schedules, internships where to fit in, But there’s also strength in that. Each step forward is a personal victory, proof that I deserve to be here every day. Even though the surrounding area isn’t the most inspiring, inside the universitys walls, I feel limitless. I’m absorbing knowledge, making connections, and proving to myself and my family that I belong in a place like this. College life is more than just learning for me it’s a path to transformation. I am determined to persevere and succeed against all odds. I belong here and no student loan, confusing equations, or overpriced textbook will stop me from succeeding! Thanks!!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at Stony Brook University has been positive. The campus is vibrant, and the faculty members are dedicated to helping students succeed. I appreciate the variety of resources available, from the well-stocked library to the support provided by academic advisors. The university offers a strong academic curriculum that has challenged me while providing opportunities for personal and professional growth. The diversity of the student body creates a welcoming environment for individuals from all walks of life.
