featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: UNF has a welcoming environment. People were actively promoting their clubs and ideas, making the campus lively. There were good turnouts for the events UNF hosts for the students. The school strives to help the students be prepared for the work life. The teachers maintained high standards for the students and encouraged them to reach out if they need support. The students are friendly and dedicated to doing well academically and socially. Recently, some construction was done to maintain the safety of the buildings and as an expansion for more classrooms. Students were given the necessary information about any changes on campus.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My experience here at Everglades University has been a wonderful, full filing and educational experience that has brought new and creative ideas to my education.  Providing many skills and most importantly the proper understanding of my field that has allowed me to excellen in my professional career.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My experience at the University of Massachusetts has been nothing short of extraordinary. The campus pulses with energy, with every corner offering new opportunities for personal growth and exploration. Engaging classes ignite my curiosity, while spirited discussions foster vibrant debates and the exchange of ideas. The connections formed with my fellow students create a tapestry of camaraderie, intertwining our shared experiences into an enriching college adventure that I hold close to my heart. Each moment spent here is a cherished memory, contributing to a collection of unforgettable experiences.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The College of Wooster experience can vary significantly by major. Studying Art History and Spanish, my professors had very high standards for our writing and research. I felt supported by all of my professors, and encouraged to come to them for help with academics or future plans. I also received a significant amount of financial aid, which made it slightly easier to tolerate the lack of resources in my chosen departments. Finding internship or volunteer opportunities was challenging in a rural town such as Wooster, and I felt that the Career Center was not prepared for students who were pursuing anything other than STEM-focused careers. Housing is adequate, and there are large stores (Meijer, Walmart, etc.) and some restaurants in the area.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love that UCSC is a school that is in a forest. Everywhere you go, it's full of nature. Being in UCSC is like taking a break from all the city places and having the chance to connect with nature while going to school. I also like that in some places around this school, you can see the beach!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The commitment to diversity and overall community made me feel at home away from home. As well, the work program gave me a resume and skills that provided a head start for my career. The small classroom sizes and low student to faculty ratio gave me an intimate experience that allowed me to really connect with my professors. As well, it prepared me for Grad School in such a way that made it a breeze. Lastly, it allowed me to graduate with only two thousand dollars in loans. Great affordable experience!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Being a student at UNR is awesome! The campus vibe is lively, with tons of clubs and activities to join, which makes meeting people easy. We're super close to outdoor spots like Lake Tahoe for hiking and skiing. Most students hang around campus, and there’s always something happening. The campus is long and skinny, so getting from one end to the other can be a trek, but you get used to it. Safety is solid – I feel really comfortable here, and there are services like Pack Rides for late-night safety. It doesn’t feel like a commuter school; there's a real traditional college atmosphere with spirited Wolf Pack games. Getting involved is key, as there are endless options to find your niche. Overall, great academics, a friendly community, and an ideal location make UNR a unique and exciting place to study.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: SUNY College of Environmental Science & Forestry

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I have loved my experience with ESF! I transferred in halfway through first year and I really found my place. Having many resources from Syracuse university next door is amazing for such a small school, and you really get the best of both worlds. People complain about the food, but for college food it really is above average. The parties are really chill, mostly small backyard parties unless you want to go to SU parties which are bigger and more frat-centered. It is a hard school though, so be prepared. Even the easiest major (environmental studies) is substantially harder than at other schools and is considered a STEM. The faculty is really amazing though.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Starting my freshman year at Gustavus Adolphus College has been an exciting and rewarding experience. As a football player and biology major, I’ve had to balance academics, athletics, and social life, but I’ve found great support here. With both my parents and my aunt being alumni, Gustavus already felt like home, and my time here so far has exceeded my expectations.

Football has given me an instant sense of community, with dedicated coaches and supportive teammates pushing me to grow. Academically, my biology classes are challenging but engaging, and the small class sizes allow for meaningful interactions with my professors. The hands-on lab work keeps me excited about my major.

Beyond academics and sports, Gustavus has a welcoming environment, rich traditions, and a beautiful campus. There’s always something happening, making college life both fulfilling and fun. So far, my experience has been everything I hoped for, and I look forward to the journey ahead.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
As a student at Appalachian State University, I can really appreciate how committed the school is to academic excellence and getting us involved. The range of undergraduate and graduate programs is impressive, especially in education, business, and sustainable development, which are some of the standout areas here. 
Campus life is super vibrant, and there’s always something going on. I love that we have easy access to outdoor adventures in the nearby Blue Ridge Mountains, which is perfect for hiking and exploring. The faculty here genuinely care about our success and create a supportive learning environment. They really push us to engage in experiential learning, whether it’s through internships, research projects, or community service. 
Overall, I feel like Appalachian State University offers a well-rounded educational experience that really prepares us for our future careers. It’s a great place to grow academically and personally!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: The University of Texas at Arlington (UTA) offers a vibrant and diverse academic environment that caters to a wide range of students.What I liked most was the supportive faculty and the sense of community among students. Professors are generally approachable and willing to help, and there are numerous student organizations and events that foster connections. The university also offers a variety of resources, such as career services and tutoring, to help students succeed academically and professionally. However, there are areas that could be improved. Parking can be a significant issue, with limited spaces and high permit costs.  Some students also feel that communication from the administration could be more transparent, especially regarding tuition changes and campus policies. Overall, UTA provides a solid education with plenty of opportunities.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at the University of South Alabama was a mix of positives and areas for improvement. The university offers a wide range of programs, and most courses were well-structured and informative. The curriculum provided a solid foundation in my field of study, and there were opportunities to engage in hands-on learning through labs and research. Many professors are passionate, knowledgeable, and genuinely invested in student success. They're approachable, willing to help outside of class, and provide valuable insights into their respective fields. However, there were professors who were less engaged, making some classes feel more like self-study. This can vary between departments, so students may have different experiences depending on their major. Overall, USA provides a decent academic experience with strong programs and dedicated faculty members. Students who seek out the best professors and utilize academic resources will likely have a rewarding experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I really liked how no matter what all the staff cares and would sit a talk to you, it didn’t matter how busy they where they would make time. Which that made it very easy to get help they show that they genuinely care and you aren’t just another person or more money. The main thing i disliked is how outdated there building are and some aren’t handicap accessible. I also feel as though if you graduate in december they don’t give you as much of a celebration i feel no matter when you graduate everyone and every class deserves to be celebrated. Their food the cafeteria serves is very iffy. Overall if you like that small town college seen and like feeling as though your part of a big family it’s the perfect school.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
I really like UNCW’s location—it’s close to the beach, which creates a unique and relaxing atmosphere, and the surrounding city has a lot of creative energy. I also appreciate the artistic opportunities here, especially in theatre and film. There are plenty of ways to get involved, whether through performances, tech work, or digital art projects, which makes it a great place for someone like me who loves both theatre and visual storytelling.

However, I do think UNCW could improve in terms of diversity and inclusion. While there are efforts being made, I’d love to see more representation, especially in the arts, where different perspectives can really shape meaningful stories. It would also be great to have more support and opportunities for students from different backgrounds to feel seen and heard.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: Sewanee - The University of the South

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved my time as a Sewanee student! I knew I wanted a college campus where I could step out of my classes and see trees rather than a highway. This place definitely gave me that. I hiked and camped on the Mountain regularly, and I enjoyed every minute of walking between classes on a campus that feels like Hogwarts. Being the first generation in my family to attend a four year college, I was intimidated at first and had some major concerns about fitting in. These concerns were replaced with a community that I felt, and still feel, deeply connected to. Playing a sport gave me a good outlet to make friends, but it didn't feel like the only way to socialize. This place is a unique blend of stunning scenery, good-natured people, and quirky traditions. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking for a strong academic college with fun people in a great setting.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: When I first came to the University of Portland, I only knew a few people. The weather was a bit hard to deal with, especially because it made the campus feel dreary, also it only added onto the feeling of not quite belonging. However, people here are more than welcoming and it was not hard to find people to become friends with. The professors that I have had have been pretty good, I have mostly had professors that I enjoyed, with only a couple that I could have done without. While it is a small school, there are a lot of clubs and student-led organizations that put in a lot of work to create fun student activities. I would say that sports aren't a huge part of the community, but I think that because our main sport is soccer instead of football. People still go to the games, but it isn't a main aspect of the school spirit.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The University of Charleston (WV) offers a supportive community, dedicated faculty, and great programs. More dining options would be nice!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Millsaps has been the perfect college fit for me.  I have grown academically, in leadership skills, in community involvement and as a person.  Millsaps in academic focused but allow you the support you need to get a full college experience.  It has given me the opportunity to play basketball, participate in student government, and be an officer in my fraternity.  The academic course work is allowing me to get a well-paid internship in my field of study this upcoming summer and gave me the opportunity to study abroad in Italy and Germany last summer.  Millsaps is a blessing that I have truly enjoyed and benefitted from.  I recommend Millsaps to anyone that wants an academic experience that will pave your future with a great college life.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love everything about Embry-Riddle! From its prestigious reputation in aerospace and aviation to the cutting-edge technology and resources available to students, it truly feels like the perfect place to study Aerospace Science. The campus environment is incredible, with like-minded individuals passionate about the industry. The hands-on learning opportunities, experienced professors, and strong connections to major aerospace companies make it an amazing place to grow. I’m especially excited about flight simulators, research opportunities, and industry networking events. I can’t wait to officially start my journey here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Since I’m just starting my journey with Drake University, I can’t speak from experience yet, but I’m already excited about the welcoming atmosphere and the support I’ve received so far. The admissions team has been incredibly kind and helpful, making the process smooth and reassuring.

What I already love about Drake is its strong journalism and media programs, the hands-on learning opportunities, and the chance to connect with professionals in the industry. I’m looking forward to being part of a creative and motivated community that will help me grow both personally and professionally.

For now, I don’t have anything I’d like to see change, but I’m excited to experience everything Drake has to offer and share more along the way!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Tennessee Tech allowed me to explore and expand. I always felt accepted when I went there. I enjoyed campus and everything was easy to find. I gained a full ride scholarship to Tech for basketball. The basketball road was a little rocky, but overall, I learned more on and off the court. Basketball taught me leadership, time management, communications skills, etc. What I would like to see change is the expansion of the campus. There was really nothing that I would change about the school.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Many options for academic paths. I am a part of the Helen Harding Honors College, and the requirements are simple to follow, and I hope to keep my standing until graduation. The option to take honors courses to fulfill community service requirements for scholarships has been extremely helpful, as those courses also go towards my Honors Student standing. 

I wish there was more stability and safety for those living on campus. In the 2 and a half years I was residing on campus, there were many dangerous situations such as trespassing, use of weapons, and unsafe living conditions including black mold in rooms, plumbing not working for weeks on end, and more.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
Taylor University was a life-changing experience! 
ACADEMICALLY - During the time I attended Taylor (2016-2020), 97% of the faculty held doctorates in their respective field of instruction. I loved class, because I got to engage experts who imparted understanding and wisdom far beyond what I could learn from a standard textbook or online resource. This rivaled the experience of my friends who attended large, public universities where the bachelor programs are often taught by adjunct professors or graduate students.
SPIRITUALLY - Taylor is a Christ-centered community that so beautifully holds fast to the truth of scripture without losing sight of the humility and love of Jesus. While no community is perfect, Taylor is marked with deeply committed relationships and campus life that exudes the fruit of the Spirit. One of my favorite memories from Taylor was gathering with my friends in the Prayer Chapel 2-3 times a week for informal worship, prayer, and Bible reading.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: It's very pretty in Decorah, and Luther capitalizes on that with frequent hikes and other outdoor activities through the rec services. The food could definitely be better, but it's not awful. The professors are very nice, and so are the administrative people I've talked to.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Where do I start. Overall, this experience has been challenging but yet exciting and adventurist. Every day I learn something new on the campus, but it isn't just the campus it's also about myself.  I learned how to not depend on others. Learning how to interact with other people on campus. I wasn't an outgoing person but being here and joining new clubs has helped me gain that social experience and other life-skills. The different writing centers, resume/cover letter sessions helped me gain experience on what to expect for my career path. The writing centers helped me be more confident in my writing and speech skills. Although I am currently freshman I can't wait to endorse and open more life obstacles in my journey of education. Honestly the way USD encourage students interact, career fairs, social banquets. I like the way it is.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
This campus has a close community feel to it. The staff and faculty are knowledgeable and eager to help students succeed. The food could be better, it is improving a little. my favorite event of the semester is relaxation day, where food is good,  the activities are fun, they really go out for their students, and are activists for mental health, student success (this sometimes mean meeting students where they are), mentoring programs.

I wish they had more classes and choices on campus, each semester i worry if this campus would become an all online campus like some universities that did so coming out of Covid pandemic. The on campus vibe is not something you get online, and connecting with faculty, and staff is one of the highlights of my undergraduate career. They really want to challenge you, and are available, or make time to talk with you,

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Ohio University has amazing opportunities for everyone. There are so many clubs and organizations to join and pursue what you are passionate about, as well as to network and meet new people! There are also many professional opportunities and the professors are very helpful and willing to provide you with what you need to succeed. The community is amazing and very welcoming to all people from different backgrounds and cultures.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: The University of San Francisco encourages you to put yourself out there because you will only receive as much as you give. The students do a great job of welcoming new incoming students and inviting them out into the city. Being in a prime location in the Richmond district next to famous sites like Golden Gate Park, Haight-Ashbury Street, as well as Alamo Square gives the USF its own unique being in the heart of the city of San Francisco. The academics at USF being in the School of Management have been a bit of a challenge, but only if you do not utilize the resources available to you. The attentive professors and small class sizes make it easy to receive the help you need through 1:1 office hours with your professor or even online coffee chat meetings with the TAs to ask about any upcoming assignments or exams. USF is one of the most diverse campuses in the United States and is open to people from different walks of life which allowed me to build lifelong relationships with my peers!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: Mount Saint Mary's University Los Angeles

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: The teachers and the students at the mount are so special. They are great people and want their peers to succeed. Teachers are willing to give us resources and help out students when needed; very giving. Admin and student financial aid is difficult to work with, they just aren't super flexible and open with students in my opinion. I would like to see that change from that aspect of admin.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My enrollment will start this year, so I have no much experience. However, I can provide general information about the university. SDSU offers a range of undergraduate and graduate programs, with a strong focus on research and community engagement. The university is known for its beautiful campus, diverse student body, and faculty expertise. If you're considering SDSU, I'd be happy to help you explore their programs and opportunities.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body:
My experience with California Baptist University has been very positive. I was enrolled in the Master of Public Administration program and appreciated the structure and depth of the coursework. The program was  providing a strong balance between theoretical concepts and practical applications. The faculty was supportive and engaged, creating an environment that encouraged learning and professional growth.
I appreciate the university's commitment to academic excellence and the flexibility of their online programs, which made it possible to balance my studies with my personal and professional responsibilities. The Christian values integrated into the curriculum also provided a unique and meaningful perspective.
One area for improvement could be enhancing the availability of networking opportunities for online students, such as virtual meetups or alumni events. These connections would be valuable for fostering professional relationships and building a sense of community among students.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I really enjoy the Wofford community. I feel like the school does a great job of providing opportunities for students to connect and get involved both within Wofford as well as in the surrounding Spartanburg, SC community. I feel the small class sizes help me feel more connected to my professors and classmates as well.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: While attending the University of Oregon, there are many enjoyable factors I have been able to experience. The campus is beautiful and constantly provides activities that any student can participate in. There are multiple opportunities for extracurricular activities that anyone can join. Furthermore, a strong sense of community is created along with supportive staff who are willing to assist in any hardship that may occur. However, there is the struggle of diversity throughout campus. There are efforts being made to change this which I believe is beneficial to the University as a whole. It can assist in producing a diverse student body and create a more inclusive environment that can connect to cultural awareness.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: A very friendly environment. They provide many helpful resources to help students academically. The staff are such great vibrant people who are very helpful as well! The school is big enough for the students who go there!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
About me: 12/2022 alum, Healthcare Studies major, off campus, Texas resident. 
SIZE: Large (20k undergrads, 50+  majors across 7 schools). My classes could range from 20-200. Never felt overwhelmed by the class size.  
LOCATION: Suburban. Very quiet, very safe. Never felt uneasy at night. Around 20-30 min away from downtown Dallas. Good for studying. 
MAJORS: There’s a little more focus on STEM/ computer science/ healthcare. However, the business school (JSOM) is really good! Has received national and international recognition. 
HOUSING: Dorms are pretty big. One dorm set up has 3 separate rooms, each w/ doors, bed &desk. And within that dorm with the three rooms, there’s a living space, an area w/ 3 sinks, and a bathroom that locks. Very spacious. 
STAFF: Mostly good. Only a few bad apples. 
STUDENT BODY: Pleasantly diverse!
ATMOSPHERE: Serene.
EXTRACURRICULARS: No football. Chess, academic clubs. There are a lot of active culture clubs! 
TL;DR: Life is what you make it here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love Utah State University. Logan is a smaller town but it has such a fun vibe and the people are so welcoming. As a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, it feels like home here as most of the students share the same values as me. It has been amazing to make friends who understand me and share similar beliefs. Academically Utah State has been awesome and has helped me grow personally and professionally. There is so much to get involved in from clubs to events and the basketball games are so fun. The energy and school spirit is one of the reasons I love Utah State. However, outside from campus Logan is a smaller town so there isn't a ton to do.. There isn't really a party scene, but it has been great for me because that doesn't align with my values. If you enjoy a quit laid back yet fun sense of community Utah State is the perfect choice!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
Jacksonville University offers a mixed experience. The academics are strong, with most professors being helpful and supportive. Coursework is challenging but manageable, and the extracurricular opportunities are plentiful, providing students with many ways to get involved and enjoy campus life. However, housing is subpar, poorly managed, and often frustrating for students. Food options are limited in variety and availability, with inconvenient hours. The biggest issue lies in the university's disorganized leadership, which often fails to follow through on promises and disregards student concerns. This creates a sense that the administration is disconnected and indifferent to student welfare. 

For those who can focus on academics and social life without dealing much with the university's management, JU can be a rewarding place to learn. However, for others, the administrative shortcomings can make it difficult to fully enjoy the student experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body:
UD is known for its rigorous liberal arts curriculum, particularly in philosophy, theology, and business. Many students appreciate the depth and breadth of the education they receive.

The campus is often praised for its picturesque setting and architecture, providing a conducive environment for study and reflection.

While the campus has its charm, some students feel that certain facilities, such as dorms and study spaces, could use modernization or expansion.

 There are suggestions for enhancing career services, including more robust internship opportunities and networking events to better prepare students for the job market.

Overall, the University of Dallas is often regarded as a place that offers a solid education within a supportive community, though there are areas where students feel improvements could enhance their experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: WVU is an amazing school and campus. As an incoming freshman I took a one credit course the week before school started called Adventure WVU where I went camping for 3 nights. Went white water rafting, rock climbing and met my now best friends! For 75 dollars I had the experience of a lifetime and got to experience WV at an amazing level! There are intramural sports and activities for every walk of life and many fun things to experience and do.  I would recommend WVU to anyone. It’s an amazing place.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love attending The University of Scranton. I choose to go to school here because of the beautiful campus and welcoming environment they have. I am now a second semester sophomore and cannot wait to continue with two more years. I am involved in a few clubs like the criminal justice club, and the ASL club. I like how the student run programing board, USPB always has fun events lined up. One thing I would like to see change is the prices at the bookstore. Although buying campus merch is not necessary, it is nice to have some but the prices can make it hard to get new clothes. Overall I would not trade this University for anything!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The mission based curriculum is excellent, campus ministry is amazing, the campus is beautiful (suburban feel in an urban setting), the professors are all amazing and curate a very intimate class setting for learning, and being in D.C. is a huge plus. However, the campus life is a little boring, due to few active clubs on campus, and the banning of school affliated fraternities making the party life on campus none existent, so there isn't much to do outside of off campus parties.  Room and board is a scam. For a minium of 5000 dollars a semester, you get extremely basic housing accommodation with very few services. The food is terrible, always has long lines, and is equally overpriced. The area directly around CUA failed to gentrify, and now has a high crime. The school is very conservative, banning anything that isn't aligned with Catholic teaching. Overall, if you're catholic and want a classical education in a great city, come here! If not, well, there's always other options.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Overall my experience at Rockhurst University has been wonderful! I've met so many new people and some of my life long friends. I love all my classes and most if not all my professors care about you as a person and not just know you as being a student in one of their classes.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved my professors and academic experience. Small class sizes meant that I had a close relationship with ALL of my professors. The administration is for profit and not at all for the benefit of their students and staff. Much development is catered to first-years, with little offered for those who stick with all four years at DPU. There are many resources and connections that translate to landing real-world experiences, but the institution is a PWI and that just inherently feels gross (even as a white student).

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: My name is Josiah, and I recently transferred to UHCL as a junior. The campus is inviting, with incredibly talented professors who have inspired me to pursue an academic career. The Kinesiology program consists of 140 credit hours and offers connections to graduate schools throughout the state. Most of my classes this past semester have been in the Recreation and Bayou buildings, and I highly recommend UHCL. The campus is academically oriented and boasts a diverse community in terms of culture, race, gender, and religion. I wholeheartedly recommend UHCL to anyone seeking an affordable, diverse, and engaging university experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: y experience at Seton Hall University has been both enriching and challenging in many ways. The best part has been the strong sense of community, with professors who are passionate about their subjects and genuinely invested in student success. The university offers great opportunities for networking, internships, and career preparation, which help students gain real-world experience. Additionally, the campus is beautiful, and there are plenty of student organizations and events that make college life engaging. However, some challenges include the high cost of tuition, occasional administrative issues, and the need for more dining and housing options. There are also some professors who are less engaging or ineffective in their teaching, which can make certain courses frustrating. Additionally, the campus food could use significant improvement in both variety and quality. I would love to see better faculty accountability, more student support services, and an upgrade in dining options.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: The school obviously could use more funding, being an older HBCU. It's very hard to put on stellar events with a tight budget. However, I believe your experience is what you make of it. Even though we do smaller things, I often enjoy the more intimate environment. This is all about creating our own unique college experience, no matter the scale. The dorms could definitely use some renovations; they're outdated and overdue. The café also needs improvement—we eat the same things constantly, which gets crazy. But despite these challenges, I've been to other schools and wouldn't want to be anywhere else than this HBCU.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My experience with Hallmark University has been very smooth so far. Upon entering, I love the people and teachers who work here. Their character speaks volumes as they are always helping students succeed by providing us with several resources and guidance. They make sure their students are mentally and physically healthy. The school offers tutoring to navigate challenging classes and balance the workload. They are always available to us at any given time and will ensure to explain everything clearly to avoid confusion. This university has established a safe space for students to ask questions and learn passionately about their careers.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: I absolutely loved my experience at Gonzaga University! The academics, athletics, and community are all strong factors that contributed to my experience at Gonzaga. I enjoy the small class sizes, which give students more opportunities to work closely with professors and better understand the class material. Participation in athletics is one of my favorite activities for students on campus. Gonzaga has a popular tradition among students to camp out the night before basketball games to get the best seats in the Kennel. In addition to academics and athletics, there are many extracurricular activities such as clubs (academic and social) as well as intramural sports for students to get involved in on campus. One thing Gonzaga could improve is providing better resources for students of color to navigate attending a PWI (primarily white institution). Many of the resources are student-run, and it would be helpful to see Gonzaga offer more support to students of color.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Yeshivath Viznitz is place to study also good in Torah teachings with a good everoment with good management

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: As of today (my third day) experiencing the campus and attending classes, I am in awe of how well UNC Greensboro operates as such a large campus! The staff have been truly kind, helpful, and receptive when asked questions, or even just in passing. The buildings (and other operational centers I've visited so far) are pristine in functionality and design, in my opinion. From what I can see, this feels like a campus that truly values its students and other important persons, which is seldom presented from colleges and universities (ESPECIALLY of this size), from my own experience and knowledge.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body:
I loved GCU! It was the only school that provided me with a way to work full-time, earn my dual degree for teaching, and still take care of my family. I was an older student, 36 when I enrolled, and the workload was challenging but doable. Some professors were better than others at engaging online students, but I only had one professor that I really did not enjoy.

I loved that I could rate and review each class and professor after each class, and I appreciated the online platform. It was easy to navigate. One thing I would have appreciated more was some kind of notification for when my counselors changed. There were several times I would log in and see a new name for my counselor, and that was quite frustrating.

I feel like the teaching program gave me a lot of great information that prepared me for a teaching career and set me up for success. I also loved the graduation itself. It was such a beautiful ceremony and well-organized.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Seattle University, a private Jesuit institution in Seattle, Washington, offers a values-driven education with small class sizes, strong professional programs, and a focus on social justice. Its urban location provides excellent networking opportunities and access to major companies like Amazon and Microsoft. The campus is beautiful and fosters a close-knit community.
However, high tuition costs, limited housing, and the city’s expensive living environment pose challenges. Additionally, the lack of a strong athletics culture and parking difficulties may be drawbacks for some students.
To improve, the university could expand housing and financial aid, enhance career services, strengthen campus life, and advance sustainability initiatives. Despite its challenges, Seattle University is a strong choice for students seeking academic excellence and ethical leadership in a dynamic urban setting.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I love Elmhurst University because it has a lot of qualified professors to teach us our intended majors. For example, I am currently studying criminology, and so far, every teacher that I have had has had some sort of link to criminal justice, and that makes me feel comfortable.  They're all also very welcoming. When I transferred to this university, everyone was friendly! it was an easy transition, everyone makes me feel like I belong here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: The school may not be located and a very populated area, but the campus itself has a lot of activities going on. There are many chances for creating a great relationship with professors as class sizes are small. Basketball games are a great time for all the fans. The campus is beautiful and surrounded by great scenery. It is easy to navigate campus. Students and professors are generally very pleasant people. Lots of opportunities to make friends. Many opportunities to be physically active. Food options are average. Academic requirements are very reasonable.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience at UW La Crosse has been awesome! Being a student athlete, I have received immense support inside and outside my athletics. I feel like I am truly gaining real world skills and responsibilities, which is a big reason why I went to college. The professors care, the campus is beautiful, and everyone is driven for success.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Southern Arkansas University is an interesting college, set in a small town that feels like home to many people. The school is fairly small, but is pretty well maintained and in a safe location. They have very relaxing scenery due to the cattle fields and many trees and fields around campus, and many of the buildings are visually pleasing. The housing on campus is sometimes a hassle to deal with and the lack of parking is immense. The upkeep in the buildings is often lacking although it could be fixed with some effort. The Campus dining is OK at the most, and "Gives food poisoning" at the worst. They have very little choices for healthy eating, and tend to lean more towards southern country food as their go to for dining. I would like to see more effort for food variety and safety, as well as some increase in effort by the campus services, as many people are unhappy with how slow and inefficient the school runs. Overall, it is a good experience, though it could better in some ways.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I completed my undergrad online however the school is very diverse has great athletics fun school activities great for students and families! Professors were great and understanding wanted us to succeed! Navigating the systems were easy and always having an advisor available  for you was great. The price beats all schools very affordable and a great community to be apart of.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I graduated SJU in 2018 and have been able to reflect how incredible of a University this is. The things you learn are actually applicable to life and work and things you take with you and use for years. Teachers are for the most part kind and caring. Big shoutouts to Dr. Mauri and Professor Erkis. They actually care about their students and I’ll never forget them even many years later. Being so close to the city is amazing, but you still get some of the peace that comes with living outside of it. The campus is absolutely gorgeous. I didn’t choose any center city schools because they didn’t have the same real campus feel. It feels like you’re at Hogwarts. I have an amazing job since graduating as a financial advisor, this school has truly taught me so much. I’m so glad I picked SJU!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Whitworth University has become my home away from home, offering an inspiring environment where I can thrive academically and athletically. The supportive community fosters a deep sense of belonging, and the faculty’s dedication to student success is unmatched. Being part of the track team has been especially meaningful. The bonds I've built with my teammates and coaches have not only pushed me to excel on the track but also taught me invaluable lessons about perseverance and teamwork. Whitworth’s balance of academic rigor and athletic camaraderie has shaped me in countless positive ways, and I couldn’t imagine being anywhere else.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I have loved it here at Dordt! The Christian environment has been phenomenal for me and I’ve grown so much here spiritually, athletically, and academically. They are making tons of great changes here creating better housing options and building a new commons!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: While attending the University of Alaska Fairbanks online, I experienced a wide variety of classes, while working full-time.  With full-time work came lots of speed bumps in the road that would prevent me from accomplishing work and meeting deadlines. However, for the most part, every professor I had was very empathetic and allowed me the time to turn in work that was truly done to the best of my ability.  The only change I would suggest to make is to increase the amount of hands-on teaching and lecturing to online students. Often times book pages are assigned and a mix of Ted talks or other various media is given as supplements for a lesson/module. This puts a lot more pressure on online students to have to implement their own learning methods since there is minimal professor-to-student direction.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
For my first year attending Towson University, my experience here had been very great. During the begging of my semester I struggled in one of my classes. My advisor reached out to me very fast and helped me get a tutor which helped me significantly! It helped me persevere and built up my courage in my classes, showed me how much resources I have at Towson. 
Some things Towson can work on is the diversity of the school, and doing events for multiple races that can help students feel welcome. Other than that Towson is a very good school!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Though I have had a few proffesors that have been dificult to work with and get in contact with, I have also had a lot of amazing proffesors and classes that make up for it. I am currently in a 3-week session class in between semesters that I thuroughly enjoy. The proffesor makes sure that everything is working well and the course work relates to the class. The classes I have taken towards my major have been incredible! The way the course work flows makes it very easy to understand and goes at a very good pace. I am very happy that I am the University of Nebraska Omaha, and I can't wait for the next semester to start. If all goes to plan I will finish my junior year, and my counslers at UNO have been very helpful towards helping me achieve that goal!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
This is a quality school. The professors put lots of effort into their classes, and you can tell they care a lot, not only about your academic success, but also your personal and spiritual success. Most students are really friendly. The food at saga/the Corner Cafe is fantastic, coming from someone who is very health conscious with a several dietary restrictions. I've heard from many upperclassmen that it used to be really bad, but that this year they've stepped it up. 

The one drawback for me is that as a kinesiology major, I have classes with a lot of freshman student athletes who don't seem to care about school much at all.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: I loved attending Scripps. I truly connected with some of the most amazing people I have come across, and was closely mentored by talented professors. This campus hosts a wide array of opportunities for its undergraduates. Not to mention its welcoming, beautiful environment. Most of all, I really value being part of the 5Cs; it is a unique experience and the community is truly interwoven.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: Rollins College represents balance and enrichment: a beautiful campus, strong academic programs, and a close community. The faculty members are approachable, passionate, and caring about their students' success. I liked the small class size, enabling quality connections and learning. The liberal arts approach nurtures critical thinking and a broad perspective. Of course, there is a place for the expansion of career and internship opportunities in general and especially for more specialized fields of study. And further extracurricular events and activities can enrich students' experience out of class. All in all, Rollins provides wonderful opportunities for personal and intellectual growth.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The University of Houston-Victoria cultivates a close-knit community among its students. The groups represented are diverse, appealing to a broad spectrum of interests, including cultural and academic organizations. Professors are committed to student success and readily offer extra help. Many tutoring centers and study groups are readily available. Strong academic performance often leads to success for many students. Better study habits and time management can greatly improve a student's grades. At the University of Houston-Victoria (UHV), dining isn't just about meals; it's a chance to socialize. Students enjoy the diverse lunchtime menu, with options like pizza and salad bars, making mealtimes more pleasant. Sharing a meal with friends is a relaxing way to connect and catch up. The University of Houston-Victoria (UHV) offers a well-rounded college experience, combining academics, social life, and student services effectively.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The administration office personnel are wonderful. They are also very helpful. Plenty of help with the financial aid application. When I started here, I was worried about making friends. All my worries went out the window fast. I made some great friends quickly. The campus is great for its size. The whole campus does not take that long to walk across. The city life around campus is great. There are plenty of places to eat out at. There is also a great park within walking distance from the campus. The class schedules are great so far. Dorm rooms are average. Two people to a dorm. The move in process was amazing and easy. Something that I had problems with was not being able to understand certain professors. The accent or dialect was hard to understand. We would take tests before the chapter was studied. Tutors have come into the class to help out. It is great knowing there are people who are willing to come help us out when the whole class is struggling.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: Nebraska Methodist College of Nursing & Allied Health

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: Being a student here feel like home. NMC is the right place if you want to advance your education, the faculty are so supportive

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Ball State has a strong athletic program, and as a sports photographer, you'd have opportunities to cover NCAA Division I teams, including football, basketball, and volleyball. The school provides access to professional-grade facilities, and media students often collaborate with the athletic department or student-run organizations like The Ball State Daily News or Sports Link. The experience can be fast-paced, with plenty of chances to build a strong portfolio while covering live events.Ball State is known for being transfer-friendly, with advisors who help students transition smoothly. The university offers a welcoming campus environment, and transfer students can engage in various student organizations, including those focused on media and photography. However, like any transfer experience, adjusting to a new campus culture and forming connections may take time.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: The Phenix City, AL Campus at Troy University is near Ft Benning Army Base making it a great  opportunity to learn with a diverse group of younger and older people; recent High school graduates, career professionals continuing education, and meet people from across the USA who are also military service members continuing education or recently retired. The local area professional employment is great for a Troy graduate. The research tools available for students to use were really good; the Professors top notch and focused on students learning the curriculum, professional, knowledgeable, and approachable to assist students. Troy has several locations, including Troy international studying abroad. The Campus at Phenix City is a newer building, overlooking the Chattahoochee River and just a block across the bridge from Downtown Columbus Georgia with plenty of restaurants and shops. They have on-campus day/night and online classes. Glad I chose Troy for my Bachelor of Science degree.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
My experience at Mid-America Christian University (MACU) has been truly enriching. The supportive faculty and small class sizes create a personalized learning environment where professors genuinely care about students' success. As a Data Analytics major with a concentration in Business Administration, I appreciate the practical, career-focused curriculum that equips me with valuable skills for the workforce. The Christian values integrated into education foster a strong sense of community, which I deeply appreciate.

However, I would love to see more internship opportunities and career development programs tailored to business and data analytics students. Expanding networking events and partnerships with local companies would provide students with greater exposure to industry professionals.

Overall, MACU has been a great place to grow academically and personally, and I am excited to continue my journey here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: NLU's advising department specifically is amazing. When I was accepted I got a personal phone call from my admissions specialist and he was very kind and helpful in getting everything I needed to get started. I've also dealt with the financial aid office quite a bit and while it may take a while for things to get done, they're very friendly and helpful.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Gorgeous campus in a demographically diverse neighborhood of the city! I absolutely have loved my time here at Loyola so far. I have made countless friends from all over the country and the campus is a perfect size where it is just big enough that it is not claustrophobic, but you consistently run into familiar faces. Most dorms are quite nice compared to some bigger school's dorms I've visited. With the city being so close and the lake right outside your door, you will always be able to find something to do in your free time and take advantage of northside Chicago. The academics are rigorous and for the most part, exceed expectation. I have made some really great connections with professors outside of academics and are therefore a lot of opportunities to network. However, some STEM departments and curriculum do not hold your hand and are brutally difficult for few good reasons making your GPA something to commit firmly to if choosing a STEM major. I also really wish we had football.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I enjoyed my experience at Sac State tremendously! The campus is well taken care of, the environment is very calm and plenty of great places to study between outdoor and indoor spaces. All of the professors I encountered were helpful and interested in helping you in your learning experience. Class sizes are relatively small 25-40 students, so you have the opportunity to get to know your classmates as well as your professor. Sporting events are always fun to attend whether it is football, basketball, or baseball. The party scene is not super huge but there are a lot of good bars and places downtown. Campus is safe and they are great at handling situations and alerting students about what is happening. Campus police is proactive is you need help and they have the blue light system as well.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I like that there are many international students studying here. It gave me a new prospective to life in other countries. Since the college is small the professors tend to focus on their students, and it is easy to receive help here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: The University of Texas at San Antonio

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
I love UTSA! The university has given me incredible opportunities, especially in my field of civil engineering. The campus is vibrant, diverse, and full of energy. I appreciate the strong academic programs, supportive faculty, and hands-on learning experiences, like my internship at Pulice Construction. The sense of community at UTSA is amazing, and I enjoy being part of such a dynamic environment.

If I could change anything, I’d love to see even more eco-friendly initiatives on campus and more resources for engineering students. Overall, UTSA has been a fantastic place for my growth, and I’m proud to be part of it

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: It offers a rigorous curriculum for hardworking students. Marshall allows students to pursue any career and offers and abundance of opportunities for their future. The campus is nice, but it would be nice to see some buildings being remodeled. However, everything is always clean. The professors are mostly highly qualified individuals, based on my personal experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: While I love attending New College, the new administrators do not care much for the opinions and desires of students. My first year was a fantastic time, where students all used to hang out and connect through events that would encourage socialization. There's a ton of resources to help maintain the health, wellness, and financial stability of students. Currently, I cannot speak on the state of the food offered since we just signed on with a new cafeteria company. However, in the past, the food was adequate and offered a diverse range of options. The athletics program isn't great since it has only recently been established and doesn't have a strong foundation, so if you're looking to come to New College to play sports, it probably isn't worth it. The college has also recently cut down on the wide range of housing options, leaving some students in hotels or cramped dorms or the USF campus, if not off campus entirely. The parties we have also tend to be smaller than wide scale frat ones.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I love LC. I’m a junior here rn and this place is Portland embodied in a school. This school is full of very unique, wonderful humans. Students: mostly women, LOTS of trans/non-binary, seriously 85%+ of the school is LGBTQ+. Wonderfully accepting place of everyone who is a kind good hearted person. That being said, if u are a bigot, if u are mean, if u judge—stay tf out of our school. You will regret coming here if you’re not accepting of the unique backgrounds this campus has to offer. The abroad programs are fantastic, scholarships are solid (though the school is fairly underfunded). The food is nice though plenty still complain: extensive vegan options and limited entree stuff, but an outlandishly good dessert/bakery section for all 3 meals of the day. The campus is absolutely beautiful (ranked ~7th US). Party scene is great, and though no one pressures you to smoke, but there’s a LOT of weed on campus. Academics and dorms are both pretty solid. Overall just a great people/school!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I've enjoyed my time at East Tennessee State University so far. I'm looking to receive my Bachelor's degree in Rehabilitative Health Sciences and then go on to earn my Doctorate in Occupational Therapy, specializing in Pediatrics. I've met some great people and have gotten involved in some fun organizations, and I'm looking forward to my next few years at this college!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
I’ve had a wonderful experience at Indiana University Kokomo. The teachers here truly care about their students—they’re always willing to go the extra mile to help us succeed. The classes are engaging, and I’ve learned so much, not just academically but also about teamwork and leadership through various extracurricular activities.
What I love most is the sense of community. Everyone is welcoming, and I've made some great friends along the way. Whether it's collaborating on projects or just hanging out after school, there’s a real sense of belonging. Overall, IU Kokomo has prepared me well for the future, and I’m grateful for everything I am learning here. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a supportive and enriching environment!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Overall good experience so far, every professor I’ve had has been very helpful and attentive. School holds quite a few on-campus activities for alumni weekly, including making valentines cards for meals on wheels recipients. However, local area around doesn’t have much to do unfortunately. Other students have mostly been pleasant to interact with, and parking is mostly not an issue. Cafeteria food is good most days, but some are a hit or miss. I am attending for the veterinary health science program, and so far would recommend to anyone considering the university!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
The campus and surrounding area are incredible. Do be aware that while it is on an island, UH is still kind of a city school-- Honolulu, while gorgeous, is very much so urban instead of the luscious greenery and unending beach that some students are expecting. There is also a culture that needs to be understood/accepted on the island. It's a double-edged sword: be prepared to be called out on your ignorance at some point for something, but also, closed-minded people tend not to do well/last on the island. So, while you may need to adjust your own thinking sometimes, you will also be surrounded and supported by people going through the same thing. If you love and respect the island, it will love and respect you right back. Truly. 

Partying is not a big thing here at all, so do not expect that. There are plenty of social outings (specifically those outdoor/with physical activity), so lots to do, but usually not at a frat house...instead, we hang out at a beach.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I know that Wisconsin Lutheran College is where I am meant to be. Each of my professors has made a strong connection with me and eagerly wants me to succeed in their class. Any time that I have asked for help on a project or assignment my professors have always been open and willing to assist me.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: Citadel Military College of South Carolina

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The school was a wonderful institution that provided life skills that I apply to my life to the this very day. It taught responsibility, accountability, reliability, respect, and discipline. I met wonderful people that are considered my life time friends.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I love Centre so much! Classes are academically challenging in the best way and professors genuinely care about their students. All of my professors have always been willing to chat with me and they say hi when they see me around campus. Studying abroad is pretty much guaranteed; I was able to have a wonderful experience during a Centreterm trip and several of my friends have studied abroad for a semester and had a blast. I am on a sports team and on that team I feel as though I am part of a family. Centre puts a lot of attention into their athletics and we are able to thrive. Campus food has improved drastically since the hiring of Chef Desmond and Einstein's Bagels is always consistent. The campus is small enough to walk across in fifteen minutes from one end to another and the population is small enough that you can recognize a lot of people, but still be able to meet new people in your classes every semester. I would recommend everyone to take a look at Centre.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
What I appreciate most about the University of St. Thomas is its welcoming atmosphere and nonjudgmental environment. Everyone here radiates a positive energy that makes it a great place to be. If you're stressed or struggling, there are plenty of resources available to help students navigate their challenges throughout the semester. The diversity on campus is another highlight, as students come from a wide range of backgrounds, including international ones. It’s inspiring to learn from and connect with people from all walks of life.

The small campus size makes it easy to get to classes, and the smaller class sizes allow for more meaningful relationships with professors almost on a friendship level. The beauty of the campus itself stands out, as my sister, who attends here, showed me its charm. While my overall experience has been very pleasant so far, I would love to see improvements in campus meals and more events that enhance student life.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: As a graduate student at Regent University, it has been a rewarding experience with respect to meeting the Dean of the University online, access to the officials for COGS, the bookstore that is online, reading all of the course material and the courses for the Graduate Degree.  I have attended virtual meetings to meet other students and was with a lot of enthusiastic professionals that are a part of the meetings. I hope to attend these virtual meetings through the entire Graduate studies.  The Regent University has a website to access career sections, it is very easy to navigate through and has extremely interesting job postings.  Regents has a virtual meeting program for spiritual guidance through their Life Coaches, then I found they offer one on one virtual meetings as appointments for classroom guidance, study guidance, scheduling management, and I am looking forward to attending these one on one meetings.  There are event postings to attend to stay actively involved in oncampus.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: University of Central Oklahoma is for the students who want a smaller, more professor student connections, more focus on academia, and cozy campus. People who prefer less stimulating classrooms would thrive at UCO. I really enjoyed the quiet but diverse campus live. The Greek Life is great at UCO, very close connections and bonds that will never break. As well as the growing sports teams, going to amazing football games in the fall followed by a thrilling hockey game in the winter. As much I as I loved the campus,  I would like to see it's growth especially in such a bustling town as Edmond, OK. There are many people in Edmond that would thrive at UCO to further their education but the campus needs to be able to grasp the attention more.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I just transferred into Molloy this spring. I really like the environment here as everyone is really helpful and it is easy to get around, make friends, and be apart of student run activities and clubs. The nursing program is really good and the school gives all their students help from tutoring to test prep in class and even study groups. The professors are helpful and care about their students and want them to pass, helping by giving out study guides and information to help any way possible. There’s always a way to reach out for help and to get support easily at Molloy.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience with Boise State University so far has been really good. The professors really care about you and your learning experience. They want you to genuinely pass and have a good time. The atmosphere is great and welcoming. Everyone is really friendly and inclusive here. There is always something to do on campus and there are a lot of different clubs that you can join. There isn't a lot I would like to see change other than the meal plans. They are expensive for most college students to afford even the lowest costing one. It is required to have a meal plan as a freshman living on campus. I have written a couple papers on that topic in my writing and literature class and have done some research and surveys about it. However, other than that I have really enjoyed my time here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: UC Riverside is known for its diverse student body, strong research opportunities, and scenic campus. Students appreciate the supportive, tight-knit community and personalized attention from professors due to the university's size. The campus is relatively affordable compared to other UC schools, making it an attractive option for many. Additionally, UCR excels in fields like environmental science, biology, and engineering, with students often praising the accessibility of faculty. However, there are areas that could be improved. Some students feel that certain campus facilities, such as dorms and classrooms, could use modernization or renovation. There's also a demand for more study spaces, particularly during busy times. Transportation options could be expanded, as some students find it challenging to navigate without a car.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Well, At first, everything was going smoothly, and I was getting it all together to begin my career in psychology, but then translations from one advisor to another kinda screwed things up, and now I am waiting to get it all back to running smoothly. It all occurred because of having things straight and then being told to withdraw from some of the classes because they thought I couldn't handle it. Surprise, I surely can achieve it, and I also want to increase my courses from three to four, maybe even five!   But overall, I have had nothing but a wonderful experience, good discussions, and the opportunity to meet new people. And I like this school it would be even cooler if i could be there in person but i am in Wyoming. Have a beautiful day!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Murray State University is a great school that offers a wide variety of courses and clubs, making it a great choice for students with diverse interests. The university is known for its strong academic programs and supportive community. One of the standout features of Murray State is its veterinary program, which is considered the best in Kentucky. This program provides students with best education and hands-on experience, preparing them for successful careers in veterinary science.
