The professors at Murray State are highly knowledgeable to their students' success. They are always willing to offer guidance and support, ensuring that students get the most out of their education. Overall, Murray State University is a great school that offers a well-rounded education, exceptional programs like the veterinary program, and a vibrant campus life.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Attending Belhaven University has been an incredible experience. I love the close-knit community, the faith-based learning environment, and the opportunities to grow both academically and personally. Being a cheerleader has been a highlight, especially performing at the Homecoming pep rally and celebrating our big win. My Old Testament class also stood out, allowing me to creatively engage with Scripture through projects like a podcast.

However, challenges like falling behind due to illness taught me resilience and time management. I would love to see more resources for students facing setbacks and additional hands-on learning opportunities in my major.

Overall, Belhaven has shaped me in so many ways. It is a place where I have grown in my faith, built lasting friendships, and discovered new passions.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: So far I have had an excellent experience at Thomas Aquinas College. The school greatly cares for its students by providing an environment which facilitates the academic, spiritual, and social health of the student. The school also provides financial aid opportunities such as work study programs that help students be able to afford their education regardless of their financial status. The academics are rigorous and thought-provoking. There are many resources for one's spiritual well-being such as on campus chaplains, a beautiful chapel, and many masses every day. The program could change by being less concerned with the discussion method. The discussion method innately favors certain personalities more than others, putting certain students, such as myself, at a great disadvantage. The school evidently favors those who are vigorous participants in class and looks down on the more reserved students, who due to their personality, struggle to participate as much as their fellow classmates.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love Providence College, especially the Civ program, which has greatly deepened my understanding of history and religion. The small class sizes create a personalized learning environment, perfect for students who thrive in close-knit settings. While the food isn't the best, it has definitely improved over time. One aspect I’d like to see change is the social scene, which is heavily focused on bars and partying. For students who aren’t into that, it can be challenging to find alternative social opportunities. Overall, Providence College offers a strong academic experience and a welcoming community.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: UNH was a great undergraduate experience. Living on campus was safe, fun and very worthwhile. The large size of the university allowed me to explore many options before deciding on a degree pathway that was right for me. The town of Durham is lovely and the campus is very beautiful and walkable. The cost of on campus living is a drawback, but the dining hall food is some of the best in the country, and absolutely worthwhile. The work study jobs are plentiful and flexible. One drawback is the lack of diversity on campus, this is a very predominantly white school. There are a few students of color and organizations supporting them, but overall the campus is extremely white.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: The University of Northern Iowa is a mid-size university, so it does not feel super overwhelming and the number of students in each class is comparable to high school. The professors teach majority of the classes and want to make real connections with students. The university also provides students with many ways to get involved in and outside of the classroom which is crucial for a meaningful college experience. I have loved UNI and everyone who graduates or attends will tell you the same!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Loras has an amazing community and I have felt nothing but welcome there. I was considering going to a bigger school for a long time, but once I toured Loras, I knew that it was the kind of environment I wanted to be in. Everyone is so nice and welcoming, and there is a lot to do on and off campus. I would recommend Loras to anyone!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: St. Joseph's University, New York - Brooklyn

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: This school is an amazing college suited for students who want to have a personal relationship with your professors. There is a smaller than average student body which allows for personal relationships with all faculty and students, with attention and help as needed. I have felt supported in every aspect of my college experience, from international student support, to career advisement, to financial support and academic support. There are plenty of clubs and events available on campus and even more opportunities to meet like minded students. The campus is beautiful, located in Brooklyn with old buildings that remain functional but still hold their historical value. I would like to see more work opportunities within the school itself such as TA positions, assistant position and work availability on campus.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: It’s my first semester here at Rutgers, Camden and overall I love the campus. It’s not too big and every building is within walking distance of each other. The library has bookable study spaces which I take frequent advantage of and safety has never been an issue for me. There are lots of on-campus activities and I love the idea of having a free period to interact with events on campus as I never experienced this in my community college before transferring. Professors are very interactive and genuinely want to see you pass their classes, every bathroom I’ve walked into is clean and shiny so I have no complaints. Another plus to going here is that they offer scholarships for study abroad programs, all you have to do is apply and you may get approved for a 3,000 scholarship, which basically covers the full cost. Studying abroad has never been an option for me as I have financial struggles but thanks to the many scholarships offered I can start to plan for it.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience has been amazing. I have been out of school for 11 years and the amazing staff members helped make the crazy experience of my last minute decision to start my college career go smoothly. Any time that I need help or have a million questions, they have been an email or phone call away helping me. Starting school online until my youngest starts going to school was stressful but each one of my professors have been amazing in helping me and guiding me to completing my courses to the best of my ability. I was not sure how well I would be able to accomplish my future goals but I can confidently say that I have finished my first semester with A's and B's. I absolutely love going to school which is crazy to say since I have been out of school for so long. I love that starting school has allowed me to virtually meet my classmates from all over. I know everyone's life can be crazy and different, but I highly suggest looking into starting college even online.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Trinity is a great school. They have made several large efforts in the past year to increase student life. For example, they added in a food pantry to help students who can't afford to eat. I have found it easier to work with financial aid here than at other colleges. Down sides include the food is terrible and the cafe has some insane rules, like you need to pay for disposable take out containers.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: Although I haven't started, I know I am going to love attending here online! I am pursuing my Master's in Organizational Psychology and Human Resources in the Fall!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I love the people and campus climate. The only bad part about campus is the dining scene. I have a gluten allergy, and they don't have much for me. I tend to make my own food, but I'm required to be on the meal plan. The housing is sufficient, they save the best dorms for freshmen and seniors. The campus is beautiful though. I'm also a Christian and despite the liberal views of the campus, we do have a Christian community club here. The professors are tough and grade like you're in grad school, but looking at the big picture it's worth it.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
Azusa Pacific University (APU) is an incredible institution that offers a well-rounded education rooted in Christian values. 
One of the standout aspects of APU is its dedicated faculty, who are passionate about their fields & genuinely care about their students' success. The small class sizes allow for meaningful interactions, personalized attention, & mentorship opportunities that make a real difference in students' academic journeys.
APU’s commitment to faith integration is another highlight. The university fosters spiritual growth through chapel services, mission trips, and community service opportunities, allowing students to deepen their faith while preparing for their future careers.
Overall, Azusa Pacific University is an outstanding choice for students seeking a Christ-centered education that prepares them to make a meaningful impact in the world. I highly recommend APU to anyone looking for a university that combines academic excellence with spiritual & personal development.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Georgia State University has been one of my greatest opportunities. I came here pursuing nursing, with a goal to go on to become a PA. The campus is beautifully seated within downtown with a gorgeous green space and new buildings. Safety hasn't been an issue, and there a preventative police in case anything were to happen. I have had only the best professors, that have guided me through this tough healthcare pathway. I am and will always be greatful for the experiences, friendships, and lifelong knowledge I have gained through this journey; and will always look back at all the memories I made along the way!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love experience Clarkson University so far! I didn't realize that this would be exactly what I was looking for in my college experience. I have support from all sides and aspects, I feel safe and secure while I'm on campus, and I feel as though the academics are very professional and educational to my goals. I would like to see food options during the break, as I am a student from Utah and can not travel home for breaks. Money is tight for traveling, so I didn't this limiting.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Texas women university is the perfect campus to enhance your studies! The campus is quiet  and safe. The students and staff are friendly and welcoming. This campus offer there students great tools such as academic support workshops, career connections, and tutoring and financial assistance as well! Overall as a first year, I can proudly say that I am a pioneer! I love that TWU isn’t known for a party school but as a resourceful school that cares for their students education! I’ve also been able to attend many fun events like the bingo nights and block party which add to the social life on campus!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Butler University is my home away from home! It is the perfect distance from my hometown that is 2 hours away. The adjustment from living at home to living on campus has been an easy transition as I had a great roommate and living experience my freshman year and again this year living in the sorority house. The class sizes of about 20-30 students is perfect for me as I feel like I can get to know my classmates and I feel comfortable asking professors for help when it is needed. There are lots of resources to get academic help from visiting professors in office hours to asking my sorority sisters for assistance if I am struggling in something. When it comes to campus life, I enjoy the atmosphere of both Butler's football games and basketball games. It is nice to be able to meet up with my friends and walk to a sporting event. When thinking about what I would like to see change is hard because I think Butler has checked off all of my boxes for a school!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Hello, everyone! My name is Jules Dufitimana, and I have been admitted to Augustana College. Although I am not there yet, as I am still completing the required steps, I would like to share some features I’ve discovered about Augustana College during my research.

It is a college located in Rock Island, Illinois, USA. It is known for its strong academic programs, welcoming community, and excellent research opportunities. The college offers a wide range of majors, including sciences, arts, and humanities, and emphasizes preparing students for careers and graduate studies.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: When you enroll, you are immediately welcomed by everyone. Everyone is so willing to help and I didn't stress too much my first week here! I will say since the dorms are all older buildings, the no AC is unfortunate but manageable. Plus the heat will turn once it gets colder. The food variety is pretty good and things seem to be sanitary in the cafeteria. The professors are all super supportive and most will tell you that you can talk to them about anything! Overall a very good experience!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My experience at Oberlin College was wonderful overall. Yes there were some bumps in the road socially and academically challenges but I wouldn't choose somewhere else if I could do my undergraduate over again. Key thing was having a community that looked like me and support me socially and culturally. I also built relationships with wonderful professors and staff that truly cared about me and my success because they were able to connect to each and every student, unlike giant public schools. While the party seen is pretty boring, the student life activities and events are great; there is always something happening on campus. And the natural areas around campus are gorgeous, especially in the fall.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
At Montana technological university, all professors are great and explain things really well in class. I learned a lot from them, and still am. 
International students are a minority, but the university has a variety of welcoming events for Internationals.
The menu at the cafeteria changes everyday, and the meals are delicious.
Student life is great, there are a lot of parties, and different events. There are a veriety of clubs, including sport clubs.
There are not many scholarships for international students though, and I wish that changes in the future. But overall, Montana technological university is a great place to be.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: My freshman year, I was not impressed with FHSU, but as I began to build friendships and join organizations, I fell in love with Hays and the university. The small class sizes offer more personal learning opportunities, and you get to know your professors really well. The organizations are also great! I'm a part of Christian Challenge and the community through that is so special.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: So far my experience at Concordia has been good. I have had primarily online classes so far and they are easy to navigate and complete, even while working two jobs. I wish the professors were more available in my online courses, as some of them live in different time zones. I will be in person next year so I am excited to start my program and get a better feel of who the other students are!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at Lee has been full of ups and downs. When the school year first started I felt very lonely and homesick. It was a really wild change from living at home and only going to school  in the morning to living on campus all day. Having a time change of an hour later was also a big change for me because my days felt really long. The community on campus felt like everyone was in their own thing and making friends has been hard for me. The semester’s have gone by so fast that I can’t believe the school year is almost over, everything was such a new experience not having all the people I was already close with be in school with me. The drives home where very tedious but worth it because it was really exciting to see my siblings happy to have me at home.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: I was enthralled with UVM. I am a high school senior at SBHS who took two college classes at UVM and worked my entire summer in an inorganic chemistry lab at the university. These experiences were incredible and developed my love of neuroscience and STEM. Additionally, these wonderful experiences made my college applications more interesting and made me more university-ready! I enjoyed the natural campus with contemporary and older-gothic buildings that were always very science. I would like to see the school change there online programs to have more interactive elements however with the lessons.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I have made several friends at Tarleton State University. I moved there from out of state not knowing a single person. I met my roommate for the Fall semester. I made the decision to go through Rush week and met several girls that I have become friends with as we went to each sorority event all week.  I had an amazing experience and joined a sorority ! Through the sorority I have made several more friendships and am happy to say we have some of the same classes together.  We hang out, grab a bite to eat,  do homework, and have fun. There are lots of events every week on campus. The sports teams are awesome !

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: As a first-year student at Spelman, I’m surrounded by Black excellence and a supportive environment where I can grow alongside other like-minded women. My professors do an amazing job connecting course material to the world around us, keeping classes engaging. They encourage free speech, thought, and open dialogue, emphasizing that learning is a mutual exchange. The food in the cafeteria is great compared to other schools, and there’s always something happening on campus—a performance, club meeting, or fundraiser. No matter your interests, there’s a space for everyone. The academic rigor here is real; you need inner ambition and dedication to succeed. Spelman truly fosters both personal and intellectual growth.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I had an overall good experience at SPU. Even though the racial & ethnic diversity was low, I never had any negative racial experiences. Students of color got to come to campus first in an effort to make it easier to connect with people of a similar background, which was nice. During my time, the student body did a lot of advocating for organizational change aiming to increase diversity and LGBTQIA+ acceptance. I had a lovely experience with my professors- the small course sizes led to building great relationships and many research opportunities. I lived on campus all four years (as an RA in campus housing and apartments my last 2 years). The dorms were so fun and I met my best friends (that I still see today) in my freshman hall. There were themed events, Big sister rituals, bonding experiences, campus competitions, and so many more things to look forward to. Food options on campus were decent & the neighborhood was safe. If you want a party, Seattle has a fun nightlife to explore.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: MSU is a good school with a lot of opportunities for low income students like myself. They offer a diverse and unique experience living high up in the rocky mountains with a variety of options for majors and schooling as well as support of any student's hobbies with the vast amount of clubs and electives they offer. Their work study program is also very accepting and is helping many students through their collage careers, including myself. I'd like for the dorm buildings to be updated sometime in the future, with some issues with gas lines and pipes, but over all it has been an incredibly welcoming experience and I'm more than happy to be living here while I pursue my degree.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I have had multiple friends and family graduate from Liberty and my experience has not disappointed. Liberty is an amazing environment to grow in your faith and academic journey. You are not just a number at Liberty they seek you out and help you get connected. The campus is beautiful and has many amenities, and the surrounding Lynchburg area has plenty to offer as well! I would highly recommend visiting for CFAW or Experience LU if you have the chance and are deciding whether or not to attend.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Southwestern Oklahoma State University offers the perfect balance of a close-knit community and personal growth. The university's faculty and staff are caring, respectful, and genuinely advocate for students when needed. I’ve always felt supported and valued as an individual rather than just another number. One area for improvement would be making campus housing more affordable, ensuring that more students can enjoy the full college experience without financial strain. Overall, SWOSU provides a welcoming and supportive environment that fosters both academic and personal success.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: After completing my first semester of college at Bradley University, my overall thoughts are very positive. The professors are very understanding and available for help. There are multiple different housing options which helps to create an environment where you fit in. As for clubs, sports, and extracurricular there are plenty to choose from, all of which are very well organized and have dedicated students in them. Peoria is not always the best area, but the immediate campus of Bradley feels safe and welcoming.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love Calvin University. I was unhappy at a big state school and decided to transfer here. I've met lifelong friends and have loved all my classes and professors. I love the environment and feeling of this school's body and connectedness. Everyone here has been so kind and makes you feel like you are more than just a number. They have so many resources and connections to help you thrive in your major/undergrad degree while setting you up for future jobs and graduate programs. They really do care about each and every student and I have enjoyed my time at Calvin University immensely. I'm already sad about the thought of leaving and I'm just a sophomore! I'm excited to see all the opportunities I will continue to get at Calvin and the connections I will be blessed with in the pursuit of my future degree and graduate program.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Manchester university has been a great way for me to come out of my shell and really experience life away from home in a greatly positive way!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: My experience at Brooklyn College as a part time student has been decent. The professors are really good at what they do and will try to help you out however you can. The tutors at the Learning Center are also really good. In terms of education, it's very solid. However the atmosphere is dry and there's not a lot of school spirit. Also, most of the food around the area is very overpriced and mediocre at best, even the food trucks at Brooklyn College. Overall, it's decent for the price that it costs as a NYC resident

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Being a school in a relatively rural area in Mississippi, I didn't expect this school to provide the typical college experience, and surprisingly thats exactly what I loved about my school. The small class sizes and campus made me feel right at home. I was able to truly immerse myself in each class and create meaningful connections with others. I believe this greatly enhanced my learning. My college experience here has been a unique one that I have genuinely enjoyed and wouldn't trade for anything.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body:
My experience with the University of the Cumberlands has been overwhelmingly positive. I appreciate the flexibility of the programs, which has allowed me to balance my education with my career and personal responsibilities. The faculty members are knowledgeable and approachable, offering real-world insights that enhance the learning experience. The coursework is rigorous yet practical, providing me with skills that are directly applicable to my field.

However, I would like to see more interactive components integrated into the online programs, such as live sessions or virtual labs, to foster greater engagement and collaboration among students. Additionally, expanding career services tailored to specific industries, such as cybersecurity, would be a valuable enhancement.

Overall, the University of the Cumberlands has provided me with a strong academic foundation and opportunities for personal and professional growth. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I really enjoyed my experience. Earlham is excellent at preparing its graduates for graduate school, and I found that the connections I built with my professors and the quality of the education I received was very high. This is a special school! The main downside is location.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: New Mexico state has a lot to offer from online classes to in person classes. Professors are friendly and helpful, they are here to support your academic journey. A Diverse campus where anyone can fit in. Food is great, from Starbucks to the campus cafeteria, there is a variety of different food types around campus. There is a lot of campus activities, clubs, and sporting events to attend, so you will always have something to do on your downtime. I live on campus and i love the housing choices. The only thing I would change would be updating family housing. This is an older campus and the family housing is a little outdated.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: NAU was my home away from home. I grew up in Phoenix and wanted to attend a school that felt completely different yet was still close to home. NAU was exactly that! The campus is beautiful, and the local community is vibrant. Living there felt like a dream for a student experiencing independence for the first time. The professors were highly supportive of our goals, and there were plenty of opportunities to meet with them one-on-one during office hours. NAU offers many excellent programs, with staff who have extensive experience in their fields. While a better selection of food and more diversity would have been nice, overall, it was a great experience!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Columbia International University has  by far the most well organized financial and communications group. They communicated quickly and thoroughly with me while I paid my way through school and worked a full time job. The professors genuinely care about their students and give extensions and extended office hours if necessary. I would recommend Columbia International University to anyone who is looking for a future university.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: The University of Tennessee at Martin provided me a home away from home. This place allowed me to take a big step away from home and out into this world (which is not as big as we think). Yes, I was still close to home, but it allowed me to blossom away from it and gain the courage to take bigger and better steps for myself. Every professor I have encountered during my time here has been nothing less than truly helpful and supportive of me, believing in me at many times I did not. People from all around come together in the classroom, widening a small town's blinded view of the world and the people in it. Not to mention the amazing food choices in this wonderful little college town!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: For anyone looking for that unique HBCU experience, Howard University is the way to go! You're able to connect with all kinds of intelligent, educated, and inspiring Black innovators. The possibilities for networking are endless. The education is untouched. You learn more about yourself than you would otherwise, not just academically, but personally.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I went back as a later in life student and graduated in 2016. I loved the campus programs and facilities, utilizing their fitness centers, their restaurants, library, and regularly attending events. I was a mentor at the Camp Matador for incoming freshman in 2016, and regularly attended their farmer's market. The school has some incredible tenured professors and adjunct faculty. Bottom line it's a gorgeous campus, great institution, and you can get as involved as you like - plenty of opportunities for all times. Also an inclusive and safe campus!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
I am having the best experience at Montclair State University! From the moment I started, I have felt supported and valued as a student. The professors here are incredibly caring and genuinely invested in their students' success. They go above and beyond to ensure that everyone understands the material and feels confident in their studies.

The campus is vibrant and filled with opportunities to get involved, whether it's through clubs, events, or just meeting new people. The resources available, like the library, academic support centers, and career services, have been incredibly helpful.

If there’s one thing I would like to see improve, it would be more availability of parking during peak hours, as it can sometimes be a challenge. But overall, my experience has been overwhelmingly positive, and I highly recommend Montclair State University to anyone looking for a supportive and engaging learning environment!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: As a second-year student at Kean University, my experience has been enriching and transformative. The diverse and inclusive environment, especially for students from multicultural backgrounds like mine, has made me feel welcome. The professors are approachable, and academic resources such as tutoring and advising are excellent. The campus is well-maintained, with spaces like the library offering quiet study areas. Kean also provides numerous clubs, events, and career development opportunities that help me grow both academically and socially. While parking and mental health resources could improve, overall, Kean has prepared me for success, and I highly recommend it to others.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Overall, I have to say that Northeastern State University is great. First, my professors, dedicated to teaching and guiding all students, even though I am an international student, have helped me a lot and given me extra time to complete my homework. Next is a global office, where I often send my worries about academic problems, the counselors have advised and given me advice so that I know how to solve those academic problems. My advisor, a friend who has accompanied me and understood my situation, Next is the campus life, although not as perfect as I thought, but still gives me the feeling of a home with clubs and cultures mixed. Finally, there is the indispensable cafeteria called market cafeteria, where there are a variety of dishes from Europe to Asia. This is probably one of the places that eases homesickness, the burden of life, and the anxiety of studying. In short, Northeastern State University is a perfect place for me to stick with for my 4-year undergraduate journey.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: While I haven't gotten to campus yet, I can say my experience thus far getting accepted and going through the process has been amazing. I live an ocean away and yet they have conferences and luncheons for incoming students, scholarships and grants available and help you every step of the way. I am truly excited to start there in the fall.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Really nice professors who want you to succeed. Not to mention the beautiful campus paired with good academics!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I LOVED my college professors! They were very caring and understanding. I would have loved to see more diversity. As a religious university, it often felt like non-religious students were less accepted.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: The academic experience was well-rounded and I was able to take a variety of courses that enhanced my learning. The housing and food is well below what should be expected at a college of this cost and it could certainly use a lot of work. Overall, I've had a good experience but it could definitely be improved.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: It’s great university and they have great professors. However, I went to their university building/campus in my city and not the main campus in Toppenish. So, the school life and other normal university activities are not there due to using a small building from a local college, and renting half of another building. If you want a campus life, then it’s not for you. If you don’t and you just want to go class and you work full time, it’s a good fit as they offer afternoon/night classes. Also, due to it not being main campus, it has its issues, but the campus in my city getting more attention and applications. So, that might change as it’s getting bigger, which may bring more opportunities and activities.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Northeastern Illinois University has provided me with a level of comfort, acceptance, and pride that other educational institutes have not provided. I have been fortunate enough to make friends with people who respect and care for me as I am, and as someone who grew up with social anxiety and a stress disorder, it was not always easy for me to form connections as those. I have also been fortunate enough to learn from educators who display great levels of passion for their classes, their subjects, and their students. While there have been instances in which their instructional methods did not always work well for me, they have been generous enough to work through these issues with me and help me maintain my good academic standing. Overall, Northeastern Illinois University has provided me with a better academic standing and a better sense of self than I have ever had before, and I look forward to continuing my journey there.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: If you are looking for a party school, this is not it. The only parties that happen are hosted by sports teams and most students just go to other Universities for parties. This is more of a commuter school and the campus is really empty on the weekends. Only one or two places in the food hall are open and for limited hours of the day. I personally, love my program and my professors. They are all very understanding and as long as you communicate, they will work with you. On campus activities are organized well and the student organizers make it fun!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Baldwin Wallace University is an exceptional academic institution where the faculty care about their students! BW is a very safe campus which should give you a peace of mind when you choosing to come here. The food is also very tasty.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Transferring to Northwest University has so far been an incredible experience! I chose Northwest primarily for the Christian atmosphere and proximity to my hometown—not expecting to be completely blown away by the genuine friendship opportunities across campus, eager and intimate prayer from friends, professors, and administrators, and the overall tangible connection with Christ-centered community. I adore it here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Starting college at Rowan University as the first in my family and friend group to attend has been both challenging and rewarding. With no one to guide me, I’ve had to figure out financial aid, class registration, and campus life on my own. Lacking the built-in support many peers have, I’ve learned to seek help from professors, advisors, and campus resources. The coursework is demanding, pushing me beyond my comfort zone, but I’m developing strong study habits and building connections. I’ve started exploring organizations and networking opportunities to support my growth. Though the journey isn’t easy, I’m proud of how far I’ve come. Being a first-generation student means breaking new ground, and I know it’s worth it.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I personally love going to Saint Francis.  The professors are all so incredibly resourceful and helpful during lectures and through answering any questions I may have.  Truthfully, all of the staff at SFU are amazing.  I love walking into Frankie's or Torvian and talking to the amazing staff there.  Everyone is so friendly and wants to connect with the student body.  Campus is also incredibly safe, which is such a nice aspect of going to SFU.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
California State University, Chico is known for its strong sense of community, beautiful campus, and supportive faculty. Students often appreciate the welcoming environment, small class sizes, and hands-on learning opportunities. The campus itself is scenic, with lots of greenery and a lively atmosphere, making it a pleasant place to study.

On the other hand, some students feel that improvements could be made in areas like housing availability and parking. Expanding resources for mental health and career counseling is another suggestion commonly mentioned.

Overall, Chico State offers a positive and engaging college experience with room for growth in student support services.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I really enjoy how inclusive the campus is. It’s a wonderful place to get started with a major that can lead you towards your future career. It’s easy to make friends and get along with the professors. Even if the work is hard, you’re always being helped. I also love the fact that IUS has connected with TimelyCare to get free therapy on campus! There are a lot of great opportunities lined up for any student wanting a future!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My time at SFA has been nothing short of amazing. I started this journey with my best friend from high school, and we decided to join the fraternity Theta Chi. It’s been a rewarding experience, strengthening our friendship and forming new bonds with like-minded individuals. My first semester was incredibly busy, balancing school with extracurricular activities like the Sports Business Society, Residence Assistance, and Hall Council. Despite the hectic schedule, I maintained a 3.4 GPA, which I’m proud of. These experiences have helped me grow academically and personally, teaching me time management, teamwork, and leadership. I’ve embraced everything college has to offer, and I’m excited for what the future holds. The connections I’ve made and the lessons I’ve learned have made this journey worthwhile, and I look forward to continuing this fulfilling adventure.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The University of Evansville is the perfect place for incoming students to meet new people and advance their education. Everyone is friendly, and you constantly see the same people throughout the day. The professors are amazing and always willing to take time out of their day to help you succeed. The university does a great job with campus and helping students feel at home.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I have had a great experience at Stetson. My professors have been great with the exception of one. There are a lot of clubs and organizations to join. The campus is a little dead on the weekends, but there are places to go in town or into Daytona for the day (or night). The food is the one area that needs drastic improvement! There are hardly any options at the main dining hall, often what they do have is of odd combinations, they run out of items, and their are not enough places to get food on the weekends because the hours of the dining locations are so random. Overall, I am happy with my decision to attend Stetson.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
Farmingdale State College wasn't my first choice, but it ended up being the perfect fit. I was initially drawn to larger universities, but the smaller, more intimate environment at Farmingdale really resonated with me.
From the moment I stepped onto campus, I felt a sense of community. The professors were incredibly approachable and genuinely cared about my success. They went above and beyond, offering extra help sessions, providing valuable career advice, and even connecting me with industry professionals.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
As a student who values academic excellence, community, and personal growth, I have found the University of Louisiana at Lafayette (UL Lafayette) to be a remarkable institution that fosters all of these qualities. UL Lafayette stands out not only for its academic rigor but also for its diverse and inclusive atmosphere that encourages students to excel in their chosen fields while maintaining a strong sense of social responsibility.
The university's dedication to providing a top-notch education is evident in its wide range of degree programs, including cutting-edge research opportunities. UL Lafayette boasts impressive faculty members who are passionate about their fields and dedicated to mentoring students, ensuring that we receive the knowledge and skills necessary to succeed in today’s competitive world.
Additionally, the campus itself is beautiful, blending modern facilities with natural beauty, which creates a positive and motivating environment for learning.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
The University of Nebraska at Kearney has been a perfect fit for me! I wanted a medium sized school and Kearney is just right. My class sizes are perfect. I worried about going to a larger institution a being lost in a large (100+ student) class, but UNK has done a great job keeping the class sizes smaller.  The instructors I've encountered so far have all been concerned about me. How I am doing in the class and always willing to give extra instruction.  So far I have felt very safe walking on campus at night but always try to do so with others.
There is always something going on!! Get involved! It's so easy to find an extracurricular activity no matter what your interests are.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I am a sophomore who lives at Drury. I play a sport for Drury and live in campus housing to help me focus my academics and athletics. Drury is a good academic college that is challenging and is great to learn at, but for those who live at Drury, there are certainly better options that could make the experience much greater.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved attending Salve Regina because it allowed me to pursue my passion for medicine while engaging in hands-on research and attending conferences. The supportive environment and the opportunity to join clubs and extracurriculars helped me grow both academically and personally. Plus, being in Newport provided a beautiful, inspiring backdrop to everything.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
I cherish my experience at CPP are as diverse as the campus itself: the fantastic food, dedicated faculty, and the stunning environment that makes learning enjoyable and fulfilling.

One of the first things that caught my attention at Cal Poly Pomona was the food. As a parent, I appreciate quality and variety in dining options, and CPP exceeds expectations. The campus eateries offer something for everyone, from grab-and-go snacks for busy students to sit-down meals perfect for unwinding after a long day. Places like Centerpointe Dining Commons are particularly noteworthy, providing an impressive selection of international cuisines, fresh ingredients, and a welcoming atmosphere.

The availability of healthy options is another big plus. With a son at homeI understand the importance of balanced nutrition, and it’s comforting to see the university promote wholesome eating habits. The accessibility of fresh produce, partly thanks to CPP’s own farm store, is a unique and fantastic feature

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: East Carolina has been an amazing experience and I personally think everybody should experience a beautiful college like East Carolina in Greenville! I love the food here and the student lifestyle as I can hangout with friends or go to sports events at any weekend. I see no changes to such a successful college, I wish you all would come visit to see the plains.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Northern Kentucky University offers an incredible academic experience with a supportive and engaging community. The campus is modern and welcoming, with top-notch facilities that create an ideal environment for learning and personal growth. Professors are approachable and truly invested in their students’ success, making every class an opportunity to grow both academically and professionally. NKU’s focus on internships, and real-world experiences ensures that students are well-prepared for their careers. The university also boasts a vibrant campus life with countless clubs, organizations, and events to participate in. It’s a place where students feel empowered and connected.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: LCU is so much more than a university. It is a home, a safe space, and a family. LCU has always been home for me. My parents both attended LCU and my father now works at LCU. From the outside LCU may look small, or underwhelming, but truly it is special. The professors, students, and faculty and staff strive to build relationships with one another. LCU is home and will always be a special place.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Minnesota State University truly feels like a home away from home. The staff and faculty are incredibly supportive, always there to ensure students feel valued, safe, and empowered. Whether it’s academic guidance, career advice, or personal support, someone is always ready to help.

What stands out most is the diversity on campus. It’s a vibrant mix of cultures and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment where everyone belongs. The opportunities to engage in activities, clubs, and community events are endless, making it easy to connect with others and grow.

The campus itself is welcoming and well-maintained, with spaces for both study and relaxation. While it’s an amazing place, enhancing sustainability efforts could make it even better.

Overall, Minnesota State University is a place where students thrive, supported by a community that genuinely cares. I’m grateful to be part of this wonderful experience!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Salisbury University has great academics and overall student life. Some professors tend to focus more on talking about their content then genuinely teaching students which makes it hard to follow along in a class. There are some professors, however, that are amazing and go out of their way to make sure that what they are teaching is being understood and is willing to set aside time for students to discuss questions with them as well. Housing at Salisbury University is hit or miss. A friend of mine, my current roommate, had to move rooms because her old dorm room had mold in it. My dorm room's AC unit has not been working since the beginning of the school year but other than that, the buildings themselves are nice and in the cluster style rooms housekeeping cleans the bathrooms every weekday. The dining hall food at Salisbury is not the best and tends to be repetitive however there are plenty of other dining options around campus for students to choose from.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Overall, I really enjoy attending MTSU! It has a really amazing program for my field of study, and I’ve been able to take advantage of some really great opportunities here. However, because MTSU is what people call a “suitcase school,” living on campus can feel isolating at times, and I feel we lack a strong sense of community because of this. That’s not to say there’s no community to be found, we have some really amazing student organizations and plenty of opportunities to engage with fellow students, but when it comes to walking around campus on the weekends, it kind of feels like you’re walking around a ghost town. Even so, I still love MTSU and couldn’t see myself at any other university.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Indiana Northwest University has a lot of good people that want you to learn, and they want to help you succeed. It can be challenging, like any school, but I think that the teachers want you to like what you learn and succeed, therefore they do their best to provide the resources to make that happen.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
The University of the Incarnate Word (UIW) is recognized for its small class numbers, mission-driven ideals, and encouraging community. The faculty's commitment is frequently praised by students, and the San Antonio location provides exciting internship and cultural opportunities. A variety of professional pathways are offered by UIW's degrees, especially in the health sciences.

Improving specific facilities, expanding financial aid opportunities, and resolving parking and transportation issues are some areas that could use improvement. Increasing options for student life could potentially improve the university experience. All things considered, UIW offers an excellent educational experience with a strong focus on community service.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Pacific Lutheran University provided me with everything I needed to successfully transition from High School Graduate to Full-Time Undergraduate student. The campus itself is beautiful, especially in the Fall/Spring seasons when color explodes around campus and everyone takes the long way to class to soak it all in. From chai tea in Hauge to Cross Cultures in the AUC, there are plenty of on-campus places to stop for a meal or quick bite between classes. The faculty at PLU is likely the greatest highlight, with professors being at the top of the game for their given field, determined to help you get there as well, if you so wish. My main topic of opposition toward PLU would be safety. Myself and several friends went through several dangerous encounters, and the Parkland area itself is not the safest place to be. Don't be walking around lower campus at night, and always try to be walking with a friend if you must be out late!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Purdue University Northwest offers a vibrant and supportive environment for students. The campus is known for its diverse community and excellent academic programs. Students benefit from small class sizes, allowing for personalized attention and strong relationships with professors. The university's focus on experiential learning ensures that students gain practical skills through internships, research projects, and community engagement. State-of-the-art facilities and a range of student organizations provide ample opportunities for personal growth and networking. Additionally, the welcoming atmosphere and commitment to student success make Purdue University Northwest an ideal place to pursue higher education and prepare for a successful career.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I honestly love it here the campus is so beautiful and amazing. Theres many things to do on campus like the planetarium and the science museum. Everything on campus is amazing honestly not just one thing. The housing is also very welcoming, and the rooms are so cute and roomy. I love living here and for anyone who is thinking about coming to usca i recommend it its honestly a wonderful place to come for your education.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: California State University - Channel Islands was overall a great school. The professors are all very nice and show that they care about their students. My time spent here was nothing but great and I gained many things from studying here. The location of the school is also great considering it has a very outdoors nature feel to it. The only change I could say I would like to see at this school is parking, it is not a major issue that affects the learning aspect but closer on campus parking would be great!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Graduated in 2023... GREAT SCHOOL! For a smaller(ish) school, it is well-known across the country. I now live in Denver and can't tell you how many people make positive comments on the school when I mention it. This school has an amazing social scene if you are into parties and bars. (Please, make sure to keep your priorities straight. So, if you have to stay in on a Saturday to finish a project or study for a Monday xxam, STAY IN). You will have next weekend to have fun drinking. Grades come first! Miami also has an amazing business school. Miami consistently produces great future leaders. Lastly, be cautious of fraternities. Like many schools, there are hazing concerns. So please guys be aware of this when pledging. Don't sacrifice your dignity to get into a certain frat. And girls, be cautious with drinks and who you take back to dorm. We have a sexual assault issue, like every college it seems.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The housing situation is a struggle, last I heard there was not even enough room to house all the freshman, and renting in Tampa is expensive! The dorms are pretty nice though compared to other campuses! Food on campus is mid, they have Einsteins, Starbucks and Chick-Fil-A but its definitely not the quality you would get off campus. Most professors are cool and more than willing to help students. UTampa offers a good selection of degree options, and switching programs is relatively easy! There are a ton of extracurriculars to do. Significant amount of international students, which is great for diversity because otherwise most of the rest of the student body are from the NE. Safety and location of campus is a big plus! There is tons to do outside of university. Parking on campus was tough when I was a student, the parking garages were always jam packed and student traffic was not always managed efficiently, but I believe they have made some improvements in this regard.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
As a first-year student at Bryant University, my experience so far has been both exciting and enriching. I love the close-knit community, the opportunities to get involved in various organizations, and the strong support system from professors and staff. The university offers a great balance of academics, leadership development, and extracurricular activities, which has allowed me to grow both personally and professionally.

One thing I’d love to see improve is more diverse dining options. Overall, Bryant has been a great place to learn, connect, and explore my interests, and I’m excited for what’s ahead!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love Kennesaw so much, the fact that it is in the suburbs is amazing! The professors there really care about their students. The student center is also really nice great food choices, I also really like the parking situation in Kennesaw State University. The fact that there is always parking is amazing. I also love the students and diversity and how people are so inclusive and open to anything. The University has also a really good accounting and business programs top then in the United States Of America. I

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Grand Valley State University has provided me with great opportunities for hands-on learning and professional growth, especially as a pre-PA student. The faculty are supportive, and resources like the Simulation Center and pre-PA club have helped me gain valuable experience. I’ve enjoyed the sense of community and the variety of student organizations available. However, I think class availability could be improved, especially for required courses, as some fill up quickly. More clinical opportunities for pre-health students would also be beneficial. Overall, GVSU has been a great place to learn and grow, and I’d recommend it to anyone pursuing a healthcare career!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I have only been a student at Anderson University for one semester but it has truly been the best college experience. The student life is wonderful because the university is so intentional with planning activities for us. The food is fairly good, always room for improvement. The people here are so kind and it is so easy to make friends. The professors and staff are so intentional and kind!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: California State University, San Bernardino (CSUSB) is renowned for its commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive community, reflecting the rich cultural tapestry of its student body. The university boasts highly dedicated professors who bring a wealth of knowledge and real-world experience into the classroom, providing students with a robust and engaging learning environment. Campus life at CSUSB is vibrant, offering a variety of clubs, organizations, and events that cater to a wide range of interests, ensuring that every student can find their niche. Additionally, CSUSB excels in student support, with comprehensive resources such as academic advising, career services, and mental health counseling designed to help students succeed both academically and personally.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Attending the University of Texas at El Paso has been a significant step in my academic journey. While I have primarily focused on my studies and responsibilities outside of school, I have had limited opportunities to engage in social activities on campus. At times, this has made me feel isolated, as I do not have close friends or peers to share my college experience with. However, I deeply appreciate UTEP’s vibrant campus and the opportunities it offers. I only wish I had more chances to explore the campus and build lasting memories with others.
Despite these challenges, I remain committed to my education and personal growth. I recognize the value of community and support, and I hope to become more involved in campus life. Receiving this scholarship would not only help alleviate financial burdens but also empower me to seek new experiences and connections that will enrich my time at UTEP.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: In terms of areas for improvement, some students have mentioned that they would like to see more diverse representation within the student body and faculty. Others have expressed a desire for more campus-wide sustainability initiatives, as well as greater efforts to foster community engagement and inclusivity.  The opportunity to dive deep into subjects that interest you, challenge yourself intellectually, and develop new skills is often a highlight of the college experience. College provides a level of independence and freedom that many students appreciate, whether it’s managing your own schedule, living away from home, or making your own decisions. College can be a time for personal growth, where you gain confidence, self-awareness, and new perspectives that shape who you are.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Life at the University of Central Missouri has been an unforgettable journey filled with opportunities for growth and connection. Being part of Greek life has given me a sense of belonging and taught me invaluable leadership skills. Participating in homecoming events, from the spirited parade to the exciting football game, has created lasting memories and deepened my school pride. Cheering on the Mules and Jennies at athletic events has been a highlight, fostering camaraderie with friends. The campus talent show allowed me to showcase my creativity and celebrate others’ talents. Through it all, UCM’s academic classes have been a cornerstone, providing practical knowledge and incredible support to help me thrive

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My overall experience at Keiser University has been incredibly positive, marked by both personal growth and academic development. From the first day, I was welcomed into a vibrant community of students and professors, with an environment where learning feels engaging and dynamic.  Academically, the professors are not only experts in their fields but are also approachable and genuinely invested in student success. They encourage critical thinking and creative problem-solving, pushing me to think beyond textbook knowledge. In all, my experience in Keiser University has been incredibly enriching. I look forward to the remainder of my time here, excited for the opportunities and challenges that lie ahead.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.abbreviation: University of North Texas at Dallas
entity.name: University of North Texas at Dallas
entity.shortName: University of North Texas at Dallas

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
I’ve truly enjoyed my time at UNT Dallas! The professors I’ve had so far are incredibly kind, helpful, and genuinely care about their students. They’re also funny and always take the time to make sure you understand the material.

Some people might overlook UNT Dallas because it’s smaller, but that’s actually one of its best qualities. If you prefer a more personal learning environment without overcrowded classrooms and still want a great education, this is the place for you. Plus, there’s still plenty of fun to be had here!

I highly recommend UNT Dallas—it’s been such a great experience for me. ✨

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love how connected everyone on campus seems to be, I’ve met people even just walking to my room. There are classes for just about anything I can think of and the professors are diverse. What I would like to see change is the upkeep they do in the buildings, especially the residential ones. It feels as though they simply do not care enough to really be maintaining them well sometimes whereas the rest of the campus is mostly pristine.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I really love IIT. It is a very inclusive community and everyday that I go to campus I feel like the opportunities are endless, socially and academically. The professors are strict but the accountability helps me actually learn the material. The food is mid but $11 for an all you can eat buffet, you can't beat it. I love how small it is and I love seeing familiar faces because if I ever want to become friends with someone it's not intimidating because we see each other around campus. All the clubs are easy to access and everyone is kind!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I came to The University of Baltimore to complete my bachelor's degree 20 years after earning my associate's degree. I was apprehensive of possibly being the "old lady" in my classes. Instead, I was pleasantly surprised that the classes were a mix of not only ages, but also genders, races, ethnicities, and backgrounds. Professors were knowledgeable of the subject matter and experienced in the field. Additionally, professors were kind and fair to all students. During the high stress times of COVID shutdown and changes from in-person to virtual learning, the school and professors were supportive throughout.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: I spent my entire undergraduate career at WT. I loved it there. I also played basketball for the University while I was there. The community was extremely supportive of the athletic department and did so much to further our individual programs. The professors at the school were extremely accommodating and cared for each individual student's success. I felt safe going anywhere on campus and in Canyon. There were always house parties or people driving into town to go to a bar or club, so there was always something going on!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: At Mount St. Joseph university the main focus is always on education, however there are many options for clubs, organizations, sports, and activities that you can participate in at the school. The community at the schools is positive and people are helpful and friendly.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I enjoyed the academics at Bob Jones University. My potential was constantly and appropriately challenged, and I saw definitive growth in my writing, rhetoric, and speaking abilities. The professors are one of the greatest assets of this university, as they are some of the most caring professors I have met in my academic career. As is the case with any religious university, there is some friction over theology and institutional policies. The student handbook definitely has more strict rules for female students as opposed to male students. I also witnessed from several friends' suspensions and expulsions that punishments for female students caught with male students are far harsher than the punishments for the male student. However, they do ask all students to sign the handbook each semester, so if you follow the rules like you say you will, you'll be fine.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Winston-Salem State University is a place where ambition meets opportunity. Every corner of campus is filled with a sense of history, pride, and determination. The professors go above and beyond, ensuring that students not only learn but thrive in their fields. The friendships and connections made here last a lifetime, built on a foundation of shared experiences and support. Whether it's cheering on the Rams at a game, participating in student organizations, or engaging in community service, WSSU encourages growth both inside and outside the classroom. The spirit of resilience and excellence defines this university, shaping students into leaders. WSSU isn’t just a school—it’s a family, a tradition, and a launching pad for success.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: I had the privilege of being a graduate student at the University of West Alabama for nearly three years. My time there was marked by a supportive and enriching academic environment that helped me grow personally and professionally. The university demonstrated a strong commitment to student success, providing the guidance and resources I needed to navigate my studies with confidence. Throughout my graduate journey, I was impressed by the accessibility and dedication of the faculty and staff. They were always willing to offer support, whether it was through academic advisement, feedback on projects, or assistance with career development. Overall, the University of West Alabama equipped me with the tools and knowledge necessary to succeed in my field while ensuring I felt valued as a student. I am grateful for the opportunities and encouragement I received during my time there, as they played a significant role in shaping my career and academic aspirations.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
