grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Hi, this review is coming from a freshman class of 2028. I feel a lot of these reviews do not give an accurate depiction of what the school is today, considering they are pretty old. The food has gotten WAY better, i love my professors besides a few class changes, and overall I have felt supported throughout my time here so far. I would say the campus life over the weekends is pretty quiet and everyone leaves to go out or go home. I live in the dorms, specifically laguna hall. I would say the dorms are amazing, we have not had any issues and it is so cool to have a bathroom for just you and your roommates. Of course this is an Assemblies of God Private University, so there is tons of chapel opportunities which I love. I would say if you need a job specifically on campus, try to stay on top of it early. The good jobs go quickly and most of the time go to the upperclassman.  I hope this review helped you and if you do choose Vanguard I am so excited for you and your journey! God bless!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Attending Marian University was a life changing and crucial experience for me in my academic life. Marian's campus felt like home to me because it offered a safe and welcoming environment that had continuous outpouring of new experiences. I felt like the values of Marian (Reconciliation,  Peace and Justice, Dignity of the Individual, and Responsible Stewardship) were shown and worked into all course work. This helped me focus on my values and beliefs that I had as an individual and continue to follow them with the support of Marian's Franciscan Values. The professors worked with each individual student to help them reach their full potential. The provided the best experience they could for the students to be able to take on the curriculum handed to them.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Christopher Newport University has been an incredible place to grow academically, socially, and personally. I appreciate the close-knit community, engaging professors, and the opportunities CNU provides to develop leadership skills. My involvement with the ROTC program has been especially rewarding, helping me build discipline, resilience, and a strong sense of camaraderie with fellow cadets. The program has not only enhanced my physical and mental strength but also prepared me to serve as a capable leader. CNU’s welcoming atmosphere, combined with the ROTC’s rigorous training, has shaped my character and future goals, leaving me grateful for my time here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: University of Arkansas at Little Rock

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
As a student at the University of Arkansas at Little Rock, I truly appreciated the professionalism of my professors. They maintained a high standard in their teaching, which inspired me to strive for excellence. The staff were incredibly supportive, guiding me through the complexities of signing up for classes. From my first day, they ensured I understood everything, making the transition seamless.

The technology for online classes is user-friendly and consistently updated, which made learning from home easy and efficient. The campus life is vibrant, filled with a variety of activities that foster a sense of community. I found the diversity on campus enriching; it opens doors to new perspectives and experiences. For prospective students, embracing this diversity is essential—it enhances the college experience and prepares you for a global society.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I have been so supported here at Oakland University! My professors are always open to talk if you have any questions and they'll take the time to walk you through what you don’t understand. It's a very welcoming and friendly environment. There is also a lot of great opportunities! I have gotten the chance to participate in things and attend events I never would have been able to in high school. There has been nothing major to complain about at all.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I am currently a sophomore at F&M and I have loved my time here so far! All of the professors I have interacted with have been down-to-earth, understanding, and extremely knowledgeable in their fields. In addition, they try to make difficult concepts easy to understand. Even when I am confused, they have been very accessible through email or office hours, and I leave feeling more confident in my understanding.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Thomas University has been the perfect place for me since the beginning. The opportunity they have given me to pursue my career in the Fitness industry is bar none. Their Exercise and Sport Science program was the best local program I could find and i find myself enjoying school more than I ever have. The campus is beautiful, the professors genuinely care about you, and all the other staff are very hospitable. I have found it very easy to make new friends and get along with my classmates. The sports here are the highlight and they always give you something to do. I recommend Thomas University to anyone considering applying to college!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I'm Isabelle (a Sophomore Nursing major at SNU), and I love it! SNU is so special because it feels like home. The community here is amazing and not something that every college offers. The professors and faculty are truly invested in your life as a student and as a Christian, and they make an effort to help you grow in your relationship with Christ throughout your college experience. I'm so thankful God led me here and for all the incredible people I've met along the way!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body:
I like Northwestern Christian College in Orange City for several reasons. First, the campus is welcoming and has a strong sense of community. The faculty and staff are supportive, and they genuinely care about students' success, both academically and personally. The small class sizes allow for more personalized attention from professors, making it easier to engage with the material and ask questions when needed.

The college also offers a great variety of programs and activities that appeal to my interests. Whether it’s a sport, a club, or a spiritual group, there’s always something to get involved with. This helps me connect with others who share similar passions and makes the college experience more enjoyable.

Overall, Northwestern Christian College is a place where I feel supported, challenged, and encouraged to grow both academically and spiritually, making it a great fit for me. It’s a place I can truly call home during my college years.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
As a new freshman at UW-Parkside, I feel excited and a bit nervous about starting this new chapter. The campus has a welcoming atmosphere, and I've met friendly people during orientation. The smaller size of the university makes it easier to navigate and build meaningful relationships with professors and classmates.

I have received great support from staff and upperclassmen during orientation. They helped answer my questions and made me feel comfortable. I like that the university focuses on hands-on learning and community engagement, which encourages applying what I learn in real-world settings.

However, I face challenges adjusting to college life and balancing my time. I worry about making new friends but hope to join clubs and attend events to connect with others. I'm eager to explore my major and the campus outdoor spaces for relaxation. Overall, I believe UW-Parkside is the right place for my academic and personal growth.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Clayton State is a great school to go to. I used to think that it was a very boring school and that there wasn’t anything going on there, but when I started attending the school, it was actually enjoyable. I made a few friends that click with me and it’s always something exciting happening in the building where I take my classes. Spivey Hall is a beautiful music place and it’s almost like you’ve entered a different world there. The Greek life at the school was something that surprised me. I didn’t expect them to be so into it. Homecoming is coming up and many people seem to be excited about it. Although Clayton State doesn’t have an official football team, it’s still fun to enjoy the activities set up by the students. I love my school!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: It was a very nice school and campus with great professors and a wonderful atmosphere for learning. The professors really cared for their students and encouraged us to do our best while also academically challenging the students.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I enjoyed the small classes, the housing and food services, the extracurriculars and student organizations, and the personal interaction and guidance with advisors. The only thing I would like to see changed is a small increase in the variety of classes offered.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
My overall experience at Western Carolina University is spectacular! I have already experienced so much around campus and I am very proud to be apart of such a beautiful community. During my time at Western Carolina, I hope to accomplish all of my academic goals which include:
-Getting good grades
-Making it onto the Deans list 
-graduate with my Masters degree (or higher degree) 
I am so fortunate to experience such a diverse form of education. It truly is the most beautiful campus and I just feel so lucky to have the opportunity to be a student at Western Carolina University.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Starting college at the University of Louisiana at Monroe has been a transformative experience for me. As a first-time college student, I was both excited and nervous about the journey ahead. Choosing Pre-Nursing as my major has been a rewarding decision, as it aligns with my passion for helping others and my interest in healthcare.

The transition from high school to college has not been without challenges, but it has taught me the importance of perseverance and adaptability. Balancing coursework with new responsibilities has pushed me to grow both academically and personally. I have learned to manage my time effectively, prioritize tasks, and seek help when needed, which has contributed to my current GPA of 3.72.

Being part of a diverse student body has broadened my perspective and allowed me to appreciate different cultures and viewpoints. This experience has strengthened my resolve to pursue a career in nursing, where I can make a positive impact on people's lives.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Gallaudet University is a community where Deaf and hard of hearing students can be together. I loved that I was able to find my deaf community/ culture here. Growing up in a mainstream school, I always lacked a deaf community- coming to Gallaudet helped fulfill my deaf identity. I would like to see Gallaudet have more of a higher education and challenges.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Loyola Maryland is a great school with a beautiful campus, great professors, and a welcoming social scene. There are so many opportunities to get involved on campus and make new friends. There's something for everyone here!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
My favorite thing about Johnson is the Christian community. I've made so many good friendships so far and have made so many great memories. I'm praying that I'm able to make more this upcoming semester! I appreciate the dorm life as well. I appreciate the safety and cleanliness of the dorms and the campus. 
Something that I would change is the food on campus. From experience, I have gotten sick after eating. I believe that the school has been informed of this for this upcoming semester, so I am not concerned going forward.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: As a junior, international, and commuter student at Manhattan University, I can say that the experience has been a mix of positives and challenges. The university’s location in New York City provides unique academic and professional opportunities. The faculty is dedicated, and the academic rigor is high, though the workload can be demanding. As a commuter, the long travel times can make balancing classes and extracurricular activities difficult. The International Student Office has been helpful. The campus is diverse, and there are plenty of clubs and events, but as a commuter, it’s harder to feel fully integrated into campus life. Despite the challenges, the quality of education and access to opportunities in NYC make Manhattan University a great place to study, especially for those seeking a global city experience.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: What I enjoy about Southwestern Adventist University is the opportunity the school gives you to better your relationship with God in all aspects of life. They integrate whole-person perspectives in all their education and aim to prepare you well for what career you are pursuing with an emphasis of developing a spiritual relationship with God while receiving your education.  Overall I enjoyed the opportunities they give for having a student life and managing an education, professors aim to help you in all manner of ways and are responsive to your educational background and needs. Overall the campus really seeks to help better you as an individual and give experiences for student life in college that will support you in your career and make lasting memories at the school.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: In the University of Minnesota Duluth, its a smaller campus compared to a big state school but still gives you the perfect college experience. The town of Duluth is such a beautiful place to site see, hike, spend time in lake superior and meet people who love the outdoors! The school offers many different clubs and activities around the school every week, and has great opportunities to get involved with sororities, find diverse groups, and become close with professors!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
Sam Houston State University is a great choice for introverts, offering a welcoming and relaxed environment with plenty of quiet study spaces and a campus that isn’t overwhelming. The class sizes in some programs are smaller, allowing for more focused learning. However, professor consistency could improve, as teaching styles vary, making some courses harder to adjust to than others. More standardized teaching methods would help create a more balanced learning experience.

Dining options also have room for improvement, as the variety and quality of food could be better. Housing is convenient but can be expensive for what’s offered, and maintenance response times can be slow. Despite these drawbacks, SHSU provides a solid education with a supportive atmosphere. With improvements in professor consistency, food quality, and housing conditions, it could be an even better experience for students, especially those who prefer a quieter and more independent college life.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Touro University is renowned for its commitment to academic excellence, providing a supportive environment for students across various disciplines. With a focus on healthcare, education, law, and business, Touro offers rigorous programs that prepare students for meaningful careers. Its small class sizes foster personalized learning, while the experienced faculty ensures students receive a top-notch education. Touro’s diverse student body and strong community values create a vibrant and inclusive campus atmosphere. Additionally, the university’s emphasis on hands-on learning and professional development equips graduates with the skills needed to succeed in their chosen fields, making it an excellent choice for higher education.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Super great facilities and nursing program. Smart and understanding professors in a good location. I am a nursing student at Milwaukee School of Engineering, where every day brings exciting and rewarding opportunities to learn and grow. The program is incredible because it blends innovative technology with practical, hands-on experiences that prepare us for real clinical challenges. Our professors are supportive and passionate, always ready to help us understand complex topics. I love the modern simulation labs and strong emphasis on evidence-based practice. The close-knit community and excellent internship opportunities have given me the confidence to pursue my dreams in healthcare. I truly feel like I am part of something special here at MSOE.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: It's definitely a very diverse community. It's full of students from the Polynesian nations. It's mixed with Melanesians, Micronesians, and Polynesians. It's a beautiful diverse community that is also attached to the church. It's a beautiful community with people of the church but it's for everyone.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: If you're looking for a university that truly empowers students and prepares them for success, North Carolina A&T State University is the place for you! With its rich history, vibrant campus life, and a strong focus on academic excellence, NC A&T offers countless opportunities for personal and professional growth. You'll find a supportive community that encourages collaboration, innovation, and leadership. Whether you're interested in STEM, the arts, business, or any other field, you'll discover programs and resources designed to help you excel. Embrace the chance to be part of something bigger at NC A&T and set yourself on a path to a bright future!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I have thoroughly enjoyed my experience at University of Central Arkansas. I am involved in several committees and programs. Before arriving on campus, I signed up to be a member a Project X. It is a program built around raising the retention rates of male students. Our school is perfect for everyone. It is inclusive. It is intentional. And it's main focus is student success. They are equipping all of us with the tools we need to succeed in this world. Our professors and other faculty actually care about our success and they want to know what's going on in our environments. They are more hands-on than other schools in Central Arkansas. Most of my friends who attend other schools are looking to transfer to my school because they are missing the caring touch we receive. I am happy to be a student at UCA - Conway!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Starting at Umary this past year was definitely nerve wracking but there is absolutely nothing to worry about. I would say this school has the best kindness imaginable. If you are sitting alone someone will always talk to you and ask you how your day is going. If you would like a 4 year program with very accepting professors and peers I would strongly recommend the University of Mary.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I am a sophomore at URI and I love it! You have to embrace the uniqueness of the school, because it is so different than most state schools. The party scene is very good, but you do have to be in Greek life. Luckily, it is not very intense and pretty easy to get a bid in a sorority. I do not know much about frats. The one thing to note is that the campus itself is pretty much in the middle of nowhere. Once you are able to have a car on campus it becomes much easier and more fun to go to the beach or anywhere in Narragansett. Another downside is probably the amount of in state students. Probably half of people are from Rhode Island, and a lot of people already know each other which makes it harder but most people I know who were from out of state made friends easily. The programs are really good and there is lots of opportunity to network for careers and find internships through the school. The dining halls are also actually really good! I love it here but it takes some getting used to.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I genuinely loved my experience Central as a 2020 high school graduate. During a difficult time for everyone in the pandemic, I was still able to find connection and community and have a great beginning class-wise, though they were online. As things opened up during my three years there, my love for CMU only grew more and became so much better. Campus life, academics, experiences like homecoming and welcome weekend, cohort experiences, on-campus living, off-campus -- I had a positive experience. Fire up!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My USC Upstate experience has been fantastic! The campus grounds and buildings are beautiful and well-maintained, creating a welcoming atmosphere. The admissions staff were incredibly helpful and responsive throughout the application process, making me feel valued. I'm also very happy with the dorms – they're comfortable, clean, and foster a strong sense of community.  The overall atmosphere is positive, with faculty and staff genuinely invested in student success. I'm excited to be here and explore all the opportunities USC Upstate offers!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I have attended JSU since fall of 2024 and I have had nothing short of a pleasant time with them. The advisors are extremely helpful in getting me where I need to go. The professors are very thorough and make it easy for online, full time working, students learn and feel like they are in the classroom. I really enjoy being a student at JSU and I am truly grateful for all they have done for me and my education in this short amount of time.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I've been going to Minot State University for just over a year now. And the professors are second to none. They're so eager to help you and encourage all your ideas and go above and beyond to help you achieve them. If you're looking for a close knit community with a friendly atmosphere, look no further than MSU. They offer a large variety of fine arts, opera, summer theater, chamber ensembles, and so many more. There's something for everyone!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Teachers care about you, tremendously. They will fight for you to graduate if you are motivated. There cand be drama among the student body because the campus is small, but this also helps you form strong bonds with your campus community, professors, faculty, and peers. I had the opportunity to be a part of many registered student organizations and start one as well. This school is great for students that take their future careers seriously, while also setting time aside to enjoy fun campus events and make long-term connections. E-I E-I E-I-U!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Evangel university is my favorite place in the world. You cannot beat the people and professors. School is school - you have homework and deadlines, and the cafeteria food isn’t always amazing. However, you will never find more sincere and wonderful people. I am so blessed to be able to do the things I love while being around the professors who care about me. My friends and the community are what make evangel feel like home. I am surrounded by thousands of students who share in my love of Jesus Christ, and that is the biggest blessing. I never have to worry about peer pressure or feeling uncomfortable, because the students value the same things I do. I would recommend evangel university to anyone who wants to find a place that truly feels like home.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I attended SWU and received a double major in Early Childhood and Elementary Education. I played basketball on the Women's basketball team, and worked as a work study student in the library.  I was able to graduate a semester early.  I had a great experience at SWU and would recommend it to anyone that wants a solid education at a vibrantly Christian school.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I am starting very soon and I am very excited. The campus is really nice and the lady giving the tour was super respectful and informative. They made sure to answer any questions

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
My experience  at Monroe College is truly transformative. From the moment I stepped on campus, I felt welcomed and supported by both the faculty and my fellow students. The professors were not only knowledgeable but also genuinely invested in my success, always available for guidance and encouragement.
The curriculum is rigorous yet rewarding, providing me with practical skills and knowledge that have been invaluable in my career. The hands-on learning opportunities, such as real-world projects, has allowed me to apply what I learned in the classroom to real-life situations, preparing me well for the professional world.
Moreover, the sense of community at Monroe College was incredible.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
I have had nothing but good experiences at San José State University. One of the primary reasons I picked SJSU was the university's excellent academic environment, particularly in the aviation program. The instructors are informed, encouraging, and offer insightful industry information to assist students get ready for careers in real-world aviation. Excellent networking and internship opportunities are made possible by the university's relationships with airlines and business experts, which has been really helpful to me.

The experiential learning aspect is among my favorite things. The curriculum, which includes technical classes and flying simulators, is meant to give students both academic understanding and practical abilities. Additionally, the campus's diversity enhances the experience by creating a vibrant and inclusive learning environment.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Overall I have had a positive experience attending Wichita State University. There are plenty of amazing professors in the Education/Teaching program and in the English department chairs and the head are very kind and understanding people. One thing about campus that almost the entire WSU population would agree on is that parking is limited, and not entirely accessible. There is plenty of useful programs on campus, such as the YMCA, student health center, the writing center, RSC, and the Student Support Center, the disability services; utilize your resources!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Amazing teachers and staff. They truly care, and theres so many resources available for students. Amazing advisors and counselors, as well as student led tutoring groups for specific classes/majors. Many amenities are also available for students campus life. Schooling is a bit pricey but worth it.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: As a social work major, I feel I've had a fairly comprehensive education between the learning environment, materials, and professors. This school is best for commuters, as there is not a whole lot to do on campus, especially on weekends. Most residents go home then. The food in the dining hall is okay, but I like the varying food options they have. It's easy to get around campus as it's on the smaller side. I've really only had issues here with parking since there's a lot of students but not enough parking spaces. There is an overflow lot, but even that sometimes was nearly full and it's in the opposite direction of where my classes were. Otherwise, as a commuting social work student, I enjoyed my time here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: William Paterson University of New Jersey

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: I started out loving William Paterson and recommending it to everyone. The value of what you get at this school for what you spend is INCREDIBLE!! This school has a lot of unique things to it like the way the Honors College works, the made to order stations at the dining hall, and the campus activities. What has disheartened me the most over the years has been the increase in required online courses. For online students, this is great. For students paying to have an in person college experience and being forced to take online courses, not great. Every semester, at LEAST two of my required classes have only been offered online. There are also not a lot of classes offered anymore, and some even required to graduate which puts you in an impossible spot. When class is in person, most students are on their phones. The general consensus I’ve gotten from my peers is that advisors at this school are not helpful. Despite this, most of the dorms I’ve been in have been awesome, staff is friendly.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Within the public health program professors actually cared! I joined a sorority and I was proud to be part of it, allowed me to connect with others which was great given that I was a transfer student. Met my best friends there. The food was actually pretty darn good for a college campus! Never lived in the dorms so I can't speak on that but I did live in 3 of the apartment complexes close to campus. If you want a heavy party scene go to the Grove, if you want something in between SouthRock Apartments and if you prefer a more relaxed environment then CampusEdge Apartments fro sure!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: My experience with LSU Shreveport has been wonderful so far. The college is really affordable, and the professors even worked with me to unlock my online work a week early due to a scheduled surgery.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The campus is very nice and there are many spaces in the school where you are welcomed. The location of Simmons University is perfect and it is near research centers that accept students. I would like to see more healthier options for food at Simmons and better quality overall. I also would like to see more student engagement in the organization of more activities and clubs, to ensure more opportunities.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I really enjoy Emporia State University. For a small educational school it’s great for the kind of life I want! I very much enjoy the teachers, they are very personal and help me understand the subjects in school. I can talk to them and they understand where I am at. I very much enjoy the online part of school. They usually have a week to get the homework’s and lessons done with

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Initially, I was really nervous to commit to a school I knew nothing about. I was worried that I would not fit in socially, and did not know if a "city scene" was the best vibe for me. After my first week, I felt right at home and cannot wait for the next three years! I have such a support system, am learning so much about my craft, and the city is absolutely gorgeous.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: As a transfer student athlete, there have been many positives about D'Youville.  Maggie and Saint are the best! Academically, it is rigiorus, but the professors are supportive of the athletes and the travel that goes with it. It is a small campus but that makes for a strong student community.  My residence hall was newly renovated but there was not a lot of storage and there were a few unfinished things when we moved in. The school does a good job of setting up activities, especially in the beginning of the year, for the students like Redfest a celebration of D'Youville complete with bands and amusement park rides.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: What I like most about Detroit mercy is the diversity we have. You get to meet many people with different ethnicities and backgrounds. It really helps broaden your perspective and feel more compassion towards others. Apart from the diversity, I also like the academics part of it. I feel like it’s definitely challenging, but it really helps bring out the most and best out of you. Seeing how far you grow and come makes you feel successful and happy. I’m not sure what I’d like to see change. Maybe something could be the events hosted on campus. Making more people aware of them. I feel like as a commuter, sometimes we aren’t made aware of certain events, but we would like to be. Overall, this is a great university and I would definitely recommend it!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The International Rescue and Relief program is really well built to include professors are involved and really care about their students, in depth learning, practical projects, and hands on learning opportunities. There are many opportunities to get involved with the community, especially on campus. The dorm and cafeteria are reasonable but a little dated.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love the environment here at Georgia College and state University. Coming in as a freshman, I was welcomed into the community by attending various networking events and joining spaces meant for unwinding from any stress of moving away from home. The academic aspect is well worth it. The professors know their content well and attempt to connect with their students in many ways. It is hard to fall behind in classes due to all the resources they provide here for our success. There are also many opportunities here outside of classwork. There is a club here for everyone. These clubs include music, Greek life, athletics, writing, theater, arts, book clubs, movie reviews, self-care clubs, mental health groups, and many more. I am also impressed the inclusivity and diversity on campus. The campus allows for everyone to be themselves and not be discriminated against based on gender, race, gender, or disability, here everyone is included all the time!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: UPS was where I found my core group of friends. It shaped the basis of my personality, someone who values interdisciplinary work, who sees the value in different perspectives, and who seeks belonging. The university is small, which means your professor will know your name and your work, which is both a blessing and a curse. You will recognize the workers in the cafeterias, in the library, in the cleaning crews. The student life includes both Greek organizaitions, an abundance of clubs to join, and plenty of open spaces to merely relax with friends. The pizza place, the Cellar, is great for a special occasion, and movies at the small theater a great way to spend a weekend evening. Closeby are the waterfront, Proctor shopping district, and tons of restaurants along 6th ave. The school is expensive, the main drawback. It feels sometimes that the tuition could be lower if they only stopped watering the lawns even int he rainy seasons...

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I have really enjoyed being at MidAmerica Nazarene University. Because it is a smaller school the professors know you personally and care about how you're doing. That is one of my favorite things about being here. I've had days that the stress affected me more, and one or all of my professors usually notice and make it a point to see if I'm doing okay. Additionally, MidAmerica Nazarene University is passionate about academics, and push their students to a higher-level of learning. Classes can be difficult, but I feel like I'm more prepared than I would have been at a different school. I would like to see MNU work on their communication, and providing for commuters better.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body:
My journey through the Master's program in Diversity and Equity in Education in the United States has been a pivotal and inspiring phase of my academic and personal growth. This program focuses on understanding and addressing the social justice issues within education, with an emphasis on recognizing and dismantling the barriers faced by students from diverse social, ethnic, and cultural backgrounds. 
The program also provides an opportunity to analyze real-world problems and develop practical solutions. 
This experience has not only broadened my academic horizons but also taught me to be more sensitive to social justice issues, which is essential when working in the field of education. I am confident that the knowledge and skills I have gained will support me in creating inclusive educational practices and promoting diversity in educational institutions around the world.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My time so far at Texas A&M University- Corpus Christi has been a wonderful experience so far. I have had many wonderful professors through my time, there are many student activities for everyone to participate in. There is a diversity of many people from over the world especially when they are on study abroad. There is always something to do every day, there are many events that go on and they try to include everyone and make a positive impact on the students. There are many clubs as well, for anyone interested in anything there is a club for it all. It is a great campus for someone who doesn't want such a huge campus, it is about a medium sized campus, it is very welcoming especially with the first week or two. It's always a good time especially since it is right by the beach too.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
I have enjoyed my experience at Hofstra University. . The campus looks amazing with tons of beautiful plants Ann's flowers everywhere . I like my classes and the professors I've had so far are very informative and they give great lectures. As a student athlete involved in volleyball , my social life during the fall semester was limited due to my commitment to practice  and tournaments.  I I am very pleased with my dorm. My room is very comfortable  and the bathroom is very spacious. Additionally, there are multiple places to eat  on campus and many choices of food to choose from. Numerous events  like sporting competitions, fall festivals and homecomings were held and public safety is always present.
 I

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: My experienced at College of Our Lady of the Elms have been amazing. The professors and faculty members are so helpful. I am happy to have been studying, working, and take care of my family all at the same time. The online program is better for parents like me.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Works Here
featuredReview.body: Overall, I have enjoyed my time at Marymount. The campus & surrounding area are very cute, and I like the small school atmosphere. Student life has really picked up over the past year and with new clubs like the MU ARC (athletic and recreation club). They have hosted awesome on and off campus event like 3 v 3 basketball tournament and a trip to the commander's game. Also, shout out to Office of well-being for doggie destress monthly! Food options have improved, but still have room for growth regarding allergy friendly options.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I really like the strong connections that are built within professors, classmates and different ethical events that are held. It makes everyone feel like they're together because of how easy it is to talk with others. Working with professors one on one and getting help and working through any difficulties just loosen's the stress within the body. Being able to talk to classmates and express how we're feeling and just having someone by you're side is just an amazing feeling. As far as ethical events, it's just amazing to see how there isn't any confliction between any of the events that are held. Everyone is invited weather it is any club that you might not feel part of. There is no discrimination, no differences that are see upon one another. Everyone is here for a reason and that is to learn and to work with each other and to push each other up. Coming to this school has made me say that there is nothing I would like to change. This is a loving environment where everyone is welcomed.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
Marywood University has a lot of strengths, particularly in terms of its diverse community and the friendliness of the campus atmosphere. Many students appreciate how approachable faculty and staff are, making it easier to find support when needed. The variety of programs and backgrounds among students adds to a rich learning environment.

On the downside, the cost of attendance can be a significant concern for many. It would be great to see more affordable options or financial aid resources to help alleviate some of that financial burden. Overall, it seems like a welcoming place with room for improvement in terms of affordability!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: Attending the University of Southern Indiana (USI) was one of the best decisions of my life. From the moment I stepped on campus, I felt a sense of belonging that only grew stronger over time. The people at USI, from classmates to staff, create an environment that is welcoming, friendly, and inspiring. Student life at USI is vibrant and full of opportunities. Whether you're interested in clubs, organizations, athletics, or campus events, there’s something for everyone. It’s easy to make lifelong friends and find your niche in this lively and supportive community. Beyond academics and social life, the campus itself is absolutely beautiful. With scenic walking trails, modern facilities, and well-maintained green spaces, it’s the perfect setting for both study and relaxation. No matter where you go on campus, you’re surrounded by an atmosphere that feels peaceful and inviting.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body:
As a first-year graduate student at the University of Michigan-Flint, I've had a rewarding experience that has exceeded my expectations.

The faculty in my program have been incredibly supportive, offering guidance and mentorship that have helped me navigate the challenges of graduate-level coursework. The curriculum is rigorous and engaging, with a focus on practical applications and real-world problem-solving.

If I were to suggest areas for improvement, I would recommend expanding funding opportunities for graduate students, such as teaching assistantships or research grants. Additionally, providing more resources and support for graduate students transitioning into academia or industry would be beneficial.

Overall, I'm grateful for the opportunity to pursue my graduate studies at UM-Flint. The university's strong academic programs, supportive faculty, and vibrant community have made for a fantastic first year, and I look forward to seeing what the future holds.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I enjoy campus life. The professors, students, and resident assistants are all greatly involved in both academics and events. The community is small, and it's easy to see recognizable faces and become familiar. Many of the professors are personable, and it's easy to make a connection with most of them. The food, regrettably, isn't always the best but it's still good. Living on campus is lots of fun, and a great opportunity. Students are normally friendly and easy to make friends with. The dorms are well-kept, and I always feel safe on campus; even late at night. I've become friends with the security guard he's so kind. (Shout out to John!) The resident assistants normally have their doors open, and anyone can peek their head in to say hello. They're always friendly and happy to have a conversation with you. My roommate and I have a great connection, and every day brings something new. I've lived on campus for nine months thus far, and I've enjoyed almost every moment of it.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Overall, my experience at Arkansas State University has been life changing! I have grown in unexpected areas, both personally and academically. I love the inclusive environment Arkansas State provides but would love to see changes in the housing options on campus. I would also like to see changes within the nursing program such as different clinical options.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Love the beautiful campus and friendly people!  I could highly recommend the University of North Alabama to any high school student looking for the perfect higher educational environment.  The professors in my classes have all been very helpful and are assisting me in thinking more clearly about my career goals.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: Oregon tech is amazing, such a great school. The offerings for my major are top as well as the softball team!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I transferred to here after graduating with my associates, and had my eye on Oneonta for a while. I like it here. Most professors here are great in my opinion. As for student-life, the location is good too, there's a lot of good restaurants in a 5-mile radius. There's a couple things to do, like shopping and there's a mall with a movie theater. Overall, the college has good academics and many activities that the school puts on.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My experience with TAMU was amazing! I chose Texas A&M University-Commerce because it offers strong academic programs and an affordable tuition that made pursuing my education more accessible. What really stood out to me was the welcoming campus atmosphere and the university’s focus on helping students succeed, both in and out of the classroom. The hands-on learning opportunities also felt like the perfect fit for my goals.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I personally have enjoyed my experience here at BGSU overall, from the connections in the community, to the active life-style here as well. The staff and community here to help navigate me through my freshmen year in college as a transfer student as well has been outstanding and very aiding. There are activities the University itself holds weekly to allow engagement and the ability to meet people and form friends and a true family here at BGSU. I am excited to continue my education here next year, and experience the fall as well.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I like it here! Everyone is really nice! My only complaint is that the food isn't very good at the cafeteria, but honestly from what I've heard from friends at other colleges it's bad everywhere. Don't expect a whole lot of school spirit, but it's great if you want to go to a small school and you aren't super interested in watching football and stuff like that.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Overall, Maine Maritime has been a positive experience which has provided an immense amount of knowledge. I have continued to only grow passion toward my program, thanks to my amazing professors. The Ocean Studies program at MMA is incredible and I am looking forward to finishing my education here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I enjoyed Nicholls State because it was close to my hometown. The school is smaller, so professors get to know students personally. I highly recommend Nicholls State University!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My freshman year of college was entirely online because of COVID so I was worried about making friends and having an enjoyable experience, but thankfully when I was back on campus my sophomore year my life immediately picked up. Classes were enjoyable and small, very different from highschool and I felt I had a lot more freedom. I got to know a lot about myself, my culture, and my religion through my experiences at Loyola. I joined the Muslim Student Association my sophomore year and was a board member all through my sophomore up until my senior year where I was the president. I was also a part of the student government association Diversity, equity, and inclusion which helped push me out there a lot. I felt very comfortable at Loyola and learned about a new pace for myself. I became a lot more independent and would enjoy walking to Tulane University and meeting up with friends there. New Orleans is a beautiful city and I embraced my New Orleans culture more!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: My time at Westminster was amazing! The classes were kept small - I think my largest class had 20 students. You get a lot of one-on-one time with the professors. You're encouraged to think outside the box and come up with creative problem solving. The courses offered were excellent.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Georgia Southern has always been home for me. I've grown up here all my life and they have always been our hometown team! It is only my sophomore year, but it has not disappointed. From Saturday football games, Sunday afternoon baseball games, or night time basketball games the athletics have it all. All games are so fun and you can experience what being a true Eagles fan is all about. As far as my education, I have had the best professors. Every one of them are so passionate about their jobs and this really makes me want to be involved in class as well as makes me excited to continue my education into the grad program. I love all my professors and the bonds I have made with them over these past two years.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Portland State is a great option for those who want a more academically and individually oriented college career. This is very much not a party school. I see it as a pro, as there is more of a community focus on academics. It can be hard to feel like you have a community since a majority of the school are transfer students, or otherwise do not live on campus. The food is great, there is a lot of options, and you are extremely close to everything Portland has to offer. Regardless of PSU being a transfer school, it is not hard to make friends and enjoy your time there. There is so much to do! One thing I would like to see change is the school's communication with students. You have to work hard to find basic information like requirements for your degree, or when a class is being offered.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
When i was in seventh grade, i had a dream about a camous where i could do sports, live in dormitories and practice high-performance sports all at once. Enrolling at Queens University of Charlotte was like that dream in real life, and i couldn't believe it. It's academical record holds a good reputation amongst other colleges in North Carolina, and its faculty members are as sweet and caring as one can imagine. Campus life is fun as well. Some may think that because of Queen's small campus that there isn't much to do, but trust me, size doesn't matter! i have met students from all over the world, and everyone is easy-going and kind, this is the perfect environment for a Royal. And in the changing of the seasons? i think that's the prettiest part of campus. For example, you get to see all the students having fun outside in the summer.

All i can say is, i'm very grateful for being a part of the Royals community, and i'm proud to represent my team in national triathlon events as well.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: I have grown to enjoy my time at Spalding over the past three years. The people I have meet have changed my life, from the professors to the students, they all have had a positive input into my college life.I play baseball for the school so that has also brought me a good amount of joy the past three years. I would however like to see the student life change here at the school. There is not much for students to do that everyone can enjoy. It is a little awkward being around certain people in the school and a better student life would help in this area.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: LeMoyne is a small school with a big community of students and professors. All professors are willing to help with a task when needed, and the college provides various opportunities to help their students succeed through tutoring, student support centers, or office hours with professors.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

entity.name: CUNY City College of New York

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I did complete my Bachelor of Science in Psychology at the College of Staten Island (CUNY). My experience at CUNY was positive, with supportive professors and coursework that deepened my understanding of psychology, social behavior, and workforce dynamics. I appreciated the diverse student body and the opportunities to engage in critical thinking and research-based learning. However, I would have liked to see more career development resources and structured support for students transitioning into graduate programs or the workforce. Overall, my time at CUNY provided a strong foundation for my professional growth, and I value the education and experiences I gained.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: One of the things I like most about my college is the inclusive and supportive environment. Students and faculty foster a sense of community that encourages open dialogue, diverse perspectives, and mutual respect. Whether it’s through classroom discussions or campus activities, everyone’s voice is valued, making the campus feel like a second home. The academic opportunities are another reason I love my college. The variety of programs and courses available ensures that students can explore their interests and develop expertise in their chosen fields. The professors are not only knowledgeable but also genuinely invested in students’ success, often going beyond lectures to provide mentorship and guidance. In summary, I like my college because it nurtures my personal and academic growth, promotes inclusivity, and provides endless opportunities to thrive. It’s a place where I feel empowered to dream big and achieve my full potential.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: St. Lawrence gave me a fantastic education that truly changed my life. I had amazing professors who were passionate about their academic fields and I made lifelong friends. I also had incredible opportunities to take my education abroad, engage in research with professors, and receive funding for internships. I would do it all again with St. Lawrence if I could.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: I’ve found that Chicago State University has a diverse community and a close-knit campus, which makes for a more personalized experience. I also appreciate CSU’s commitment to community engagement, as it’s great for anyone wanting to make a difference. However, I do think the campus could use some improvements, especially in terms of their food court as there isn't a lot to offer.  It would be nice to have more extracurricular activities and events to get involved in as well.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: EMU is a great school. There is so much to do in the area. Being a small dry campus, there are not really any parties on campus but there is usually something close by on the weekends. It is the perfect balance of being able to go out and be social while also having the luxury of coming back and it being pretty relaxed and quiet. The food is ok, the den is usually a better option than the caf. Housing is not hateful. There are occasionally issues with air conditioning in the upperclassmen buildings but the Freshman and Sophomore buildings make it easy to find peoplpe that you get along with. It is very easy to venture out and find your people here, and there is usually always an event on campus.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: I took High School Dual Credit through Dakota State University. I live in this college community in Madison, South Dakota. For my first post-secondary learning experience, DSU did a phenomenal job helping me with any questions I had throughout the semester. My professors have all been proficient teachers and communicators. The university is expanding and improving as well, with a brand-new athletic complex in the works. I liked it so much that perhaps unlike many of my peers, I'd like to stay in this small town, with educators I can connect with and use as a monumental foundation for my future career life.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: The University of Houston-Downtown (UHD) is a public university located in the heart of downtown Houston, Texas. It offers over 40 undergraduate and graduate degree programs in fields like business, science, technology, humanities, and public service. Known for its affordability and accessibility, UHD serves a diverse student body with flexible options, including online and evening classes, which are ideal for working professionals. The campus is strategically situated near Houston’s business and cultural hubs, providing students with valuable internship and networking opportunities. UHD emphasizes student success through small class sizes, personalized support services, and community engagement. With a strong commitment to academic excellence and social impact, UHD prepares students for rewarding careers and leadership roles in an ever-changing world.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: During my first year, I struggled to balance school and work since I had to pay my tuition and other expenses. After saving enough money to cover the next two semesters, I knew I needed another source of income. Unfortunately, financial aid wasn’t an option for me, so scholarships became my only hope. The professors here are open-minded, and I always take advantage of office hours whenever they’re available. My advisors at the College of Liberal Arts have been incredibly helpful in narrowing down my options and guiding me toward the right path. Some classes that many students see as unnecessary, like the first-year seminar, actually provide valuable insights. That class helped me understand the campus and resources available at UNLV, while the second-year seminar helped me reflect on my long-term goals. Overall, UNLV has given me a great education and so much more. I’m grateful to be part of this university!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: have personal experiences, but I can share general insights about Fordham University! Fordham is known for its strong liberal arts education, Jesuit values, and prime locations in New York City (Lincoln Center and Rose Hill campuses). Students often highlight the university’s commitment to social justice, rigorous academics, and access to career opportunities in NYC. The campus culture balances a traditional college experience with the energy of city life. How has your experience at Fordham been?

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: Stockton University is a school that is welcoming, has open arms, and determined to get people involved. I am in the process of getting my Bachelor's degree in Social Work. The professors that I have had and/or have now have always been helpful and very good at aiding us into becoming great social workers. The amount of programs, clubs, and communities service events are outstanding. The only thing is, is that they should provide events on the weekend as well to people who can not attend them during the week. Stockton is a very safe and supportive school as well. They provide a lot of resources for students and especially food services for us as well. Stockton is an amazing community.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
My experience with Meredith College has been positive overall. I appreciate the supportive environment, strong academic programs, and dedicated faculty who genuinely care about student success. The sense of community and tradition is something I value deeply, and the focus on empowering women is inspiring.  

However, I believe there’s room for improvement in fostering diversity and inclusion. While the campus feels safe, more efforts could be made to celebrate different cultures and address issues like racism, which can be disheartening. Encouraging open dialogue, providing diversity training, and hosting cultural events could help create a more inclusive community.  

Meredith College is a place of growth and opportunity, and I hope to see it continue evolving into an even more welcoming and diverse environment where everyone feels valued and respected.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Graduate Student
featuredReview.body: ISU provided an incredible experience that shaped my personal and professional growth. As a Special Education major, I had outstanding professors who were both educators and mentors, always offering support and real-world preparation.Beyond academics, ISU offered a welcoming and safe campus environment. Living in university apartments was a great experience- comfortable, nice, and provided a strong sense of community. I always felt safe on campus, which allowed me to fully enjoy everything ISU had to offer. Being in a sorority and serving as a student organization president gave me leadership opportunities that strengthened my confidence and community involvement. ISU fosters a welcoming environment, making it easy to build lifelong friendships and connections. The combination of strong academics, supportive faculty, and vibrant campus life made my time at ISU truly special. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a well-rounded and enriching college experience!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love going to school here, the education is great and the professors really care about your success!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: My experience at Walla Walla University has been exactly what I've always wanted in a higher education experience. I have yet to meet a professor or student who doesn't care about the school and ensuring everyone has the best experience and learning opportunities possible. Being involved in athletics and engineering as well gives me a different experience than most, so being able to push myself both academically and physically within the golf team has been great for my time here.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: My overall experience with Western Illinois University has had its up and downs. Coming into WIU I was excited to meet new people and gain new opportunities. I was able to make new friends and join many organizations such a Latín Fraternity, Mutlicultural and leadership groups. Joining these organizations has brought me many opportunities that has helped my journey throughout college. I appreciate how envolved and welcoming student life has been and the connection I’ve made along the way. However, the biggest challenge Ive had to face is paying for tuition. After the semester of Fall 2024, I feared that I wasn’t able to return because of my remaining balance that was restricting my ability to register for Spring 2025 classes but with the help of family members I was able to continue my education. WIU faces with many problems distributing students financial aid and scholarships . I would like to see WIU strengthen their financial ability to support their students afford college.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Hanover College gives students the opportunity to receive a world class "Ivy League" style education, all while being able to compete in athletics at a high level, participate in an amazing Greek life scene, and develop into a well-rounded adult. Although my experience was excellent there are some things that need cleaned up. My main two concerns were the eating on campus. Most of the time it was great, however there were several meals throughout the week that were terrible. I also didn't appreciate the way campus safety handles the parking situation for students, ticketing almost constantly and not enforcing parking rules when need be.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: In my time as an undergraduate student here at Chaminade University, I have found great opportunities to explore new avenues and career choices while remaining home and connected to my community. The ability to take online courses while remaining a full-time day student has been great, because I am able to pursue other ventures like internships and jobs outside of school while still completing all my necessary credits. One difficulty I have found in my time here is that courses are sometimes cancelled due to low enrollment, and if they are a graduation requirement it becomes a complex process to ensure enrollment so one can take the courses. The campus community is very tight knit, because of the size of the university, so there is a very high chance you will know the other students in your classes. That has been a great benefit, as there are opportunities to study together and help one another out.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Being a student at Agnes School has been an incredible experience. Coming from England, I immediately felt welcomed by the supportive community and inspiring atmosphere. I love the school’s emphasis on academic excellence, paired with a strong focus on extracurricular activities. The cultural diversity here has enriched my perspective, and the inclusive environment makes it easy to feel at home. The dedicated teachers and well-maintained campus facilities create the perfect setting for both learning and personal growth. I’m truly grateful to be part of such a vibrant and nurturing institution.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Northwest Nazarene University has so far been a great experience. I love the spiritual aspect of the school and the professors are very considerate of their students. I strongly believe NNU has and will make a strong impact on me. I did struggle to see a little more involvement with events around school.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I loved my classes, my professors, my peers, and getting to know the campus.As an 18-year-old, it feels like the perfect place to start my college journey. The campus is vibrant, and I love how diverse and inclusive it is—it feels like there’s a place for everyone here. I’m able to meet people from all walks of life, and the classes are challenging but exciting. I’m learning so much, not just from textbooks, but from all the experiences and perspectives I get exposed to every day. Plus, San Francisco itself is such an inspiring city with so much to explore, from the arts and culture to amazing food spots. What’s awesome is the location!San Francisco is such a cool city with endless things to do, from the beaches to all the art and music scene. Plus, there are so opportunities here! Honestly, I feel like SFSU is giving me the perfect balance of academics, personal growth, and experiences that will shape who I am over the next few years. I’m so excited to see where this journey takes me!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Other
featuredReview.body: Midwestern State University is a beautiful campus with a green grass platform. Midwestern State University (MSU) in Wichita Falls, Texas, offers a supportive and vibrant campus environment. Known for its small class sizes and personal attention, MSU provides an accessible and well-rounded education. The faculty is dedicated, and students have access to a range of academic programs, including strong health sciences, business, and arts offerings. The campus is scenic, with modern facilities and a welcoming atmosphere. MSU also offers a variety of extracurricular activities, fostering a strong sense of community. While the location is relatively quiet, it provides a peaceful setting ideal for focused study and personal growth.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: I chose to attend John Carroll University for several reasons. The campus is smaller and classes are more condensed, meaning I receive individualized attention from my professors. JCU is close to where I live, enabling me to commute every day instead of live on-campus. It has over 100 student organizations, which suits me perfectly because I love being involved in a wide variety of activities. Currently, I'm in four clubs and have three on-campus jobs. JCU also has a leadership development program, allowing me to hold six leadership positions during my time as an undergraduate student.
